The document serves as evidence of the transfer of ownership, ensuring that the property is transferred in a legally binding manner.
A Deed of Assignment may be used in various situations, such as the sale or transfer of property, assignment of lease rights, or transfer of beneficial interests.
It may require the signatures of the parties involved, as well as witnesses, to validate the transfer.
The Deed of Assignment is typically registered at the land registry to provide public notice of the change in ownership and maintain accurate records of property transactions.
This document is essential for establishing clear property rights and facilitating smooth property transfers within the legal framework.

轉讓契約是一份法律文件，用於將財產的所有權從一方轉移給另一方，而不使用「轉讓契約」一詞來解釋。
它詳細列出了轉移的條款和條件，包括涉及的各方姓名、財產詳細信息以及任何具體的條款或限制。
這份文件作為證明所有權轉移的依據，確保財產以合法約束的方式轉移。
轉讓契約可應用於不同情況，如財產的出售或轉讓、租賃權的轉讓或利益權的轉移。
它可能需要涉及方的簽名以及見證人的簽署，以確認轉移的有效性。
轉讓契約通常會在土地註冊處登記，以公開通知所有權變更並維護財產交易的準確記錄。
這份文件對於確立清晰的財產權利並促進法律框架內的順利財產轉移至關重要。
This type of document is a legal agreement that transfers the ownership rights of a property from one party to another.
這種文件是一份法律協議，將一方對房產的所有權轉移給另一方。
DEED OF ASSIGNMENT OF RENTAL INCOME:
A Deed of Assignment of Rental Income is a legal document that transfers the right to receive rental income from one party to another, without using the exact phrase "Deed of Assignment of Rental Income" in the explanation.
It outlines the terms and conditions of the assignment, including the names of the parties involved, details of the rental property, and any specific provisions or restrictions.
This document serves as evidence of the transfer of the right to receive rental income and ensures that the transfer is legally binding.
The Deed of Assignment of Rental Income can be used in various situations, such as when a property owner assigns their rental income to another party or when a landlord transfers their right to receive rental payments.
It may require the signatures of the involved parties and the endorsement of witnesses to validate the assignment.
The Deed of Assignment of Rental Income is typically registered at the land registry to provide public notice of the assignment and maintain accurate records of the rental income transfer.
This document is essential for establishing clear ownership rights and facilitating smooth transfers of rental income within the legal framework.

出租收入轉讓契約是一份法律文件，將租金收入的權利從一方轉讓給另一方，而不在解釋中使用「出租收入轉讓契約」這個詞語。
它概述了轉讓的條款和條件，包括涉及的各方姓名、租賃物業的詳細信息以及任何具體的規定或限制。
該文件作為轉讓租金收入權利的證明，確保轉讓具有法律約束力。
出租收入轉讓契約可應用於各種情況，例如物業所有者將其租金收入轉讓給另一方，或房東將其收取租金的權利轉讓給他人。
它可能需要相關方的簽名以及見證人的背書，以確認轉讓的有效性。
出租收入轉讓契約通常在土地註冊處進行登記，以向公眾公告轉讓事宜並保持準確的租金收入記錄。
該文件對於確定清晰的所有權權利並在法律框架內順利轉讓租金收入至關重要。
This type of Document is a legal agreement that transfers the rights to receive rental income from one party to another for a specific property.
這類文件是一份法律協議，將收取租金的權利從一方轉讓給另一方，涉及特定的物業。
DEED OF FAMILY ARRANGEMENT:
A Deed of Family Arrangement is a legal document that outlines an agreement reached among family members regarding the distribution or management of assets, without using the specific term 'Deed of Family Arrangement' in the explanation.
It is commonly used in situations such as inheritance, division of property, or financial arrangements within a family.
The deed typically sets out the terms and conditions agreed upon by the family members involved, including the transfer of ownership, allocation of assets, or settlement of disputes.
It ensures that the family arrangement is legally binding and provides clarity on the rights and responsibilities of each party.
The deed may require the signatures of all involved family members, as well as witnesses or legal representatives, to validate the agreement.
By documenting the family arrangement, the deed helps maintain a clear record of the agreed-upon terms and provides a reference for future legal purposes.
The deed may be registered with the land registry or other relevant authorities to ensure its public record and enforceability.

家族安排契約（Deed of Family Arrangement）是一份法律文件，用於規定家庭成員之間關於財產分配或管理的協議，不使用「家族安排契約」這個具體術語來解釋。
在繼承、財產分割或家庭財務安排等情況下，這份契約通常被使用。
這份契約一般列明家庭成員之間達成的條款和條件，包括財產轉讓、資產分配或爭議解決等。
它確保家庭安排在法律上具有約束力，並明確了每個當事人的權利和責任。
這份契約可能需要所有參與的家庭成員簽字，以及證人或法律代表的見證，以確認協議的有效性。
通過記錄家族安排，這份契約有助於保持協議的明確記錄，並提供未來法律用途的參考。
這份契約可能會在土地登記或其他相關機構登記，以確保其公開記錄和可執行性。
This type of document is a legal agreement made within a family to determine the distribution or arrangement of assets or property rights.
這類文件是一份在家庭中簽訂的法律協議，用於確定財產或財產權的分配或安排。
DEED OF GIFT:
A Deed of Gift is a legal document used to transfer ownership of a property or asset as a gift, without using the specific term "Deed of Gift" in the explanation.
It is commonly used when someone wishes to gift their property or asset to another person or entity.
The Deed of Gift outlines the details of the gift, including the description of the property or asset being transferred and the names of the parties involved.
It typically includes clauses specifying that the transfer is a gift and that there is no expectation of payment or consideration in return.
The document may also include any conditions or restrictions attached to the gift, such as restrictions on future sale or use of the property.
By executing a Deed of Gift, the donor legally transfers their ownership rights to the recipient, effectively transferring ownership of the property or asset.
The Deed of Gift may be registered with the land registry or relevant authorities to ensure its public record and enforceability.

捐贈契約是一份法律文件，用於將財產或資產作為禮物轉讓，而不在解釋中使用「捐贈契約」一詞。
當某人希望將其財產或資產作為禮物贈予他人或實體時，通常會使用捐贈契約。
捐贈契約詳細說明了禮物的細節，包括轉讓的財產或資產描述以及涉及的各方姓名。
通常包括規定轉讓是一個禮物，並且沒有期望得到報酬或對價的條款。
該文件可能還包括附加到禮物的任何條件或限制，例如對財產未來出售或使用的限制。
通過執行捐贈契約，捐贈人合法地將其所有權轉讓給受贈人，從而有效地轉讓了財產或資產的所有權。
捐贈契約可以在土地登記處或相關機構註冊，以確保其公開記錄和可執行性。
This type of document is a legal instrument used to transfer ownership of a property as a gift from one party to another.
「這類文件」是一種法律文件，用於將財產作為禮物從一方轉讓給另一方的所有權。
DEED OF LOAN:
A deed of loan is a legal document used to formalize a loan agreement, without using the term 'deed of loan' in the explanation.
It outlines the terms and conditions of the loan, including the loan amount, interest rate, repayment schedule, and any collateral or security provided.
The deed of loan establishes the rights and obligations of both the lender and the borrower in relation to the loan.
It may include provisions regarding late payment penalties, default consequences, and dispute resolution mechanisms.
The document is signed by both parties and serves as evidence of the loan agreement.
The deed of loan helps protect the interests of the lender by providing legal recourse in case of non-payment or breach of the loan terms.
It can be registered with the land registry or relevant authority to ensure its public record and enforceability.

貸款契約是一份法律文件，用於正式化貸款協議，而不使用「貸款契約」這個詞語來解釋。
它概述了貸款的條款和條件，包括貸款金額、利率、還款計劃以及提供的任何擔保或抵押物。
貸款契約建立了貸方和借方在貸款方面的權利和義務。
它可能包括有關逾期付款罰款、違約後果和爭議解決機制的條款。
這份文件由雙方簽署，作為貸款協議的證據。
貸款契約有助於保護貸方的利益，提供法律救濟，以應對未付款或違反貸款條款的情況。
它可以在土地註冊處或相關機構進行登記，以確保其公開記錄和可執行性。
This type of document is a legal agreement that outlines the terms and conditions of a loan provided by one party to another for the purpose of financing a property.
這種文件是一份法律協議，詳細說明了一方提供貸款給另一方，以資助房產的條款和條件。
DEED OF MUTUAL COVENANT AND MANAGEMENT A:
The deed of mutual covenant and management agreement with plan is a legal document that governs the rights and obligations of property owners in a specific development.
It establishes rules and regulations for the management and maintenance of the property, including common areas, facilities, and utilities.
It outlines the responsibilities of property owners regarding property usage, repairs, renovations, and compliance with community guidelines.
The agreement may include provisions related to the collection of maintenance fees, dispute resolution mechanisms, and enforcement measures.
It typically includes a detailed plan that delineates the boundaries of individual units and common areas within the development.
The deed of mutual covenant and management agreement with plan is a binding contract between the property owners and serves to promote harmonious living and the proper management of the development.
It is an important document for property owners as it provides a framework for the governance and administration of the property.

互助契約書和帶有平面圖的管理協議是一份法律文件，規定了特定開發項目中業主的權利和義務。
它建立了對該物業的管理和維護的規則和條款，包括公共區域、設施和公用事業。
它明確了業主對物業使用、維修、翻新以及遵守社區指引的責任。
該協議可能包括有關收取維護費用、爭議解決機制和執行措施的條款。
通常包括一份詳細的平面圖，清楚劃定了開發項目中各個單位和公共區域的界限。
互助契約書和帶有平面圖的管理協議是業主之間的約束合同，旨在促進和諧共處和正確管理該開發項目。
對業主來說，它是一份重要文件，為物業的治理和管理提供了框架。
This type of document is a legally binding agreement that outlines the rights, responsibilities, and management provisions among property owners in a housing development, accompanied by a plan.
這種文件是一份具有法律約束力的協議，詳細規定了住宅發展項目中業主之間的權利、責任和管理條款，並附有一份規劃圖。
DEED OF MUTUAL COVENANT INCORPORATING MA:
The Deed of Mutual Covenant incorporating Management Agreement with Plan is a legal document that outlines the rights and obligations of property owners within a specific development project.
It establishes rules and provisions for the management and maintenance of the property, including common areas, facilities, and utilities.
It sets out the responsibilities of owners regarding property usage, maintenance, renovation, and compliance with community guidelines.
The agreement may include provisions related to the collection of maintenance fees, dispute resolution mechanisms, and enforcement measures.
It typically incorporates a detailed plan that clearly delineates the boundaries of individual units and common areas within the development project.
The Deed of Mutual Covenant incorporating Management Agreement with Plan serves as a binding contract among owners, aiming to foster harmonious coexistence and proper management of the development project.
For owners, it is an essential document that provides a framework for the governance and management of the property.

「相互契約及管理協議書連同規劃圖」是一份法律文件，明確規定特定發展項目內業主的權利和義務。
文件建立了物業管理和維護的規則和條款，包括公共區域、設施和公共設施的使用。
它訂明業主對物業使用、維護、裝修以及遵守社區守則的責任。
協議可能包含有關收取維修費、爭議解決機制和執行措施的條款。
通常，它還包括詳細的規劃圖，清楚劃定發展項目內各個單位和公共區域的界限。
「相互契約及管理協議書連同規劃圖」是業主之間的約束性合同，旨在促進和諧共處和正確管理發展項目。
對業主而言，這是一份重要文件，為物業的治理和管理提供了框架。
This type of document is a legally binding agreement that outlines the rights, responsibilities, and management provisions among property owners in a residential development, including a plan.
這類文件是一份具有法律約束力的協議，概述了住宅開發項目中業主之間的權利、責任和管理事項，包括一份規劃圖。
DEED OF RECTIFICATION:
A Deed of Rectification is a legal document used to correct errors or discrepancies in previous documents related to land or property.
It is used to rectify mistakes in deeds, agreements, or other recorded documents that may affect the ownership or rights associated with a property.
The purpose of the deed is to provide an official and legally binding mechanism to correct inaccuracies or omissions in previous documentation.
It may involve correcting errors in property boundaries, descriptions, names, or other relevant details.
The deed typically requires the agreement and signatures of all parties involved in the original document.
The Deed of Rectification ensures that the corrected information is accurately reflected in the land registry records.
It provides clarity and certainty regarding the accurate representation of the property and its associated rights.

修正契約書是一份法律文件，用於糾正土地或財產相關的先前文件中的錯誤或差異。
它用於糾正契約、協議或其他已記錄文件中可能影響財產所有權或權利的錯誤。
修正契約書的目的是提供一個官方且具有法律約束力的機制，以糾正先前文件中的不正確或遺漏之處。
它可能涉及修正財產界限、描述、名稱或其他相關細節的錯誤。
修正契約書通常要求原始文件中涉及的所有方同意並簽署。
修正契約書確保修正後的信息在土地登記記錄中準確反映。
它提供了有關財產及其相關權利的準確表述的明確性和確定性。
This type of document is a legal instrument used to correct errors or inconsistencies in a previously executed deed or document related to the property.
這類文件是一種法律文件，用於糾正先前執行的與該財產有關的契據或文件中的錯誤或不一致之處。
DEED OF RELEASE:
A Deed of Release is a legal document used to release or discharge a party's rights, claims, or obligations related to a property.
It is a voluntary agreement between parties involved in a property transaction to release each other from any liabilities, disputes, or obligations.
The purpose of a Deed of Release is to provide a formal and legally binding mechanism for the parties to relinquish their rights and responsibilities.
It is commonly used in situations such as property settlements, lease terminations, or the settlement of disputes related to a property.
The Deed of Release outlines the terms and conditions under which the parties agree to release each other and may include provisions for compensation or other considerations.
Once executed, the Deed of Release serves as evidence of the parties' agreement to release their rights and obligations.
It provides clarity and finality to the parties involved and helps ensure a smooth and legally valid resolution.

「解除契約書」是一份法律文件，用於解除或免除與財產相關的一方的權利、索賠或義務。
這是買賣房產交易中涉及的各方之間自願達成的協議，解除彼此的責任、爭議或義務。
解除契約書的目的是為了提供一個正式且具有法律約束力的機制，讓各方放棄彼此的權利和責任。
它通常用於財產清算、租約終止或解決與財產相關的爭議的情況。
解除契約書明確說明各方同意解除彼此的權利和義務的條款和條件，可能包括賠償或其他考慮事項。
一旦執行，解除契約書作為各方同意解除權利和義務的證據。
它為參與方提供明確性和最終性，確保順利且具有法律效力的解決方案。
This type of document is a legal agreement that releases or relinquishes certain rights or obligations associated with the property.
這種文件是一份法律協議，用於釋放或放棄與該財產相關的某些權利或義務。
DEED OF SEVERANCE:
A Deed of Severance is a legal document used to separate or divide the ownership of a property into distinct shares or units.
It is typically used in situations where co-owners of a property wish to hold their interests separately and independently.
The Deed of Severance establishes the individual ownership rights and responsibilities of each co-owner.
It defines the specific share or portion of the property that each co-owner is entitled to and outlines their respective rights and obligations.
The document may include provisions related to the management, maintenance, and use of the property by the individual owners.
It is commonly used in cases of shared property ownership, such as tenancies in common or joint tenancies.
The Deed of Severance provides clarity and legal certainty regarding the division of property ownership and helps avoid potential disputes or conflicts among co-owners.

分割契約書（Deed of Severance）是一份法律文件，用於將財產的所有權分割或劃分為不同的份額或單位。
它通常用於共同擁有財產的情況下，希望將其權益分開並獨立持有的共有人之間。
分割契約書確立了每位共有人的個別所有權和責任。
它界定了每位共有人所擁有的具體份額或部分，並概述了他們各自的權利和義務。
該文件可能包含與個別所有人對財產的管理、維護和使用相關的條款。
它通常在共有財產所有權的情況下使用，例如普通共有或聯合共有。
分割契約書為財產所有權的分割提供了明確性和法律確定性，有助於避免共有人之間的潛在爭議或衝突。
This type of document is a legal agreement used to separate or divide a property into separate ownerships, typically in the context of shared ownership or leasehold arrangements.
這類文件是一份法律協議，用於將財產劃分為獨立的所有權，通常用於共有或租賃安排的情況下。
DEED POLL:
A Deed Poll is a legal document executed by an individual to change their name.
It is a unilateral declaration of a person's name change, without the need for the consent of any other party.
The Deed Poll serves as evidence of the individual's new name and is widely recognized and accepted by various institutions and government authorities.
It can be used to update personal records, identification documents, and official records to reflect the new name.
The Deed Poll typically includes the person's previous name, the new name they wish to adopt, and their signature.
Once executed, the Deed Poll is legally binding and can be used as proof of the individual's name change in legal and administrative matters.
The document is often used in situations such as marriage, divorce, or personal preference for a different name.

一份契約債券是由個人執行的法律文件，用於更改其名字。
它是個人單方面聲明的名字更改，無需其他任何方的同意。
契約債券作為個人新名字的證據，被各種機構和政府機構廣泛承認和接受。
它可以用於更新個人記錄、身份證明文件和官方記錄，以反映新名字。
契約債券通常包括個人的舊名字、他們希望採用的新名字和他們的簽名。
一旦執行，契約債券在法律上具有約束力，可以用作個人名字更改的證明，用於法律和行政事務。
該文件通常在婚姻、離婚或個人偏好更換名字等情況下使用。
This type of document is a legal instrument executed by one party, typically a single individual, to declare a change in name or status.
這種文件是由一方（通常是個別個體）執行的法律文件，用於宣告姓名或狀態的變更。
DUPLICATE OF UNDERTAKING LETTER:
A duplicate of an undertaking letter is a replicated copy of the original undertaking letter.
It serves as a backup or replacement for the original document in case it is lost, damaged, or unavailable.
The duplicate of the undertaking letter contains the same terms, conditions, and commitments as the original letter.
It is issued to provide a valid and enforceable record of the undertaken obligations.
The duplicate letter is legally recognized and accepted as equivalent to the original letter.
It can be used for reference, verification, or enforcement purposes by relevant parties or authorities.
The duplicate of the undertaking letter ensures that the commitments and responsibilities stated in the original letter are upheld and honored.

擔保信函的副本是原始擔保信函的複製品。
它作為原始文件的備份或替代品，以防遺失、損壞或無法取得。
擔保信函的副本包含與原始信函相同的條款、條件和承諾。
它被發出以提供一份有效且可執行的承諾記錄。
擔保信函的副本在法律上被承認並接受，與原始信函具有同等效力。
它可供相關方或有關機構作為參考、核實或執行的依據。
擔保信函的副本確保了原始信函中所述的承諾和責任得到履行和遵守。
This type of document is a duplicate copy of a letter that contains a promise or commitment made by one party to another.
這類文件是承諾或承諾信的副本，其中包含一方對另一方的承諾或承諾。
EQUITABLE MORTGAGE:
An equitable mortgage is a type of mortgage created by an agreement or arrangement between the borrower and the lender.
It provides security for a loan without the need for a formal written document or registration at the land registry.
The equitable mortgage arises when the borrower transfers an interest in the property to the lender as security for the loan.
While the legal title remains with the borrower, the lender holds an equitable interest in the property.
The equitable mortgage is enforceable in a court of law and grants the lender the right to take possession of the property or sell it to recover the loan amount in case of default.
It is important to note that an equitable mortgage may not offer the same level of protection as a registered mortgage.
Parties involved in an equitable mortgage should seek legal advice to understand their rights and obligations.

擔保抵押是一種由借款人和貸款人之間的協議或安排所創立的抵押。
它為貸款提供了抵押物的安全性，而無需正式的書面文件或在土地註冊處登記。
當借款人將財產的利益轉移給貸款人作為貸款的抵押時，擔保抵押即形成。
雖然法律所有權仍歸借款人所有，但貸款人在財產上擁有公平利益。
擔保抵押在法院中是可執行的，並賦予貸款人在違約情況下佔有該財產或將其出售以收回貸款金額的權利。
需要注意的是，擔保抵押可能無法提供與已登記抵押相同的保護程度。
參與擔保抵押的各方應該尋求法律意見，以了解他們的權益和義務。
This type of document refers to a mortgage that is recognized and enforced based on the principles of equity rather than the legal title of the property.
這種文件是指根據公平原則而不是財產的法律所有權來承認和執行的抵押貸款。
FINAL RELEASE:
A final release refers to the complete and unconditional discharge of any obligations, claims, or encumbrances related to a property.
It is a legal document that signifies the conclusion of a transaction or agreement, releasing all parties from their respective obligations.
The final release typically involves the settlement of financial matters, termination of contractual relationships, and the relinquishment of any rights or interests in the property.
It signifies that all conditions, terms, and requirements of the transaction have been fulfilled and that there are no remaining obligations or liabilities.
The final release is typically executed and recorded to provide legal certainty and evidence that all parties involved have fulfilled their responsibilities.
It provides a clear title to the property, ensuring that there are no outstanding claims or encumbrances that could affect its ownership or transferability.
The final release is an important document in the land registry records, confirming the successful completion of the transaction and the release of any associated obligations.

最終釋放指的是對於房地產相關的所有義務、權益或負擔的完全、無條件的解除。
這是一份法律文件，表示交易或協議的結束，解除各方的義務。
最終釋放通常涉及財務事務的解決，合同關係的終止，以及放棄對該房地產的任何權益或利益。
它表示交易的所有條件、條款和要求都已履行，並且沒有剩餘的義務或責任。
最終釋放通常需要執行並記錄，以提供法律確定性和證明所有相關方已履行其責任。
它提供了清晰的房地產標題，確保沒有未解決的索賠或負擔會影響其所有權或可轉讓性。
最終釋放是土地登記記錄中的重要文件，確認交易的成功完成和解除相關義務。
This type of document signifies the final release or discharge of any existing obligations, claims, or encumbrances related to the property.
這種文件表示已經最終解除了與該財產相關的任何現有負擔、索賠或限制。
FINANCE UNDERTAKING:
A finance undertaking is a legal document that outlines the borrower's commitment to repay a loan secured against a property.
It sets out the terms and conditions of the loan, including the principal amount, interest rate, repayment schedule, and any other relevant provisions.
The finance undertaking is usually executed between the borrower and the lender, and it creates a legal obligation for the borrower to fulfill their repayment obligations.
This document is registered with the land registry to establish the lender's rights and interests in the property as security for the loan.
It provides evidence of the borrower's indebtedness and allows the lender to take legal action in the event of default.
The finance undertaking may also include provisions related to the lender's rights to enforce the security and recover outstanding amounts.
It plays a crucial role in documenting and enforcing the financial arrangement between the borrower and the lender in relation to the property.

財務承諾是一份法律文件，概述了借款人承諾還款的義務，並以房地產作為抵押物。
該文件規定了貸款的條款和條件，包括本金金額、利率、還款計劃以及其他相關條款。
財務承諾通常由借款人和貸款人簽署，確立了借款人履行還款義務的法律約束力。
此文件在土地登記處登記，以確立貸款人對該房地產作為抵押品的權益和權利。
它提供了借款人債務的證據，並使貸款人能夠在違約情況下採取法律行動。
財務承諾還可能包括與貸款人執行抵押權和追討未付金額相關的條款。
在記錄和執行與該房地產相關的借款人和貸款人之間的財務安排方面，它扮演著關鍵的角色。
This type of document represents an agreement to provide financial support or assistance for a specific purpose related to the property.
這種文件代表同意提供財務支援或協助，用於與該物業相關的特定目的。
FIRE SAFETY COMPLIANCE ORDER UNDER S.6(1:
It is a legal order issued under Section 6(1) of the Fire Safety (Buildings) Ordinance (Chapter 572).
The order is related to ensuring fire safety compliance in buildings.
It outlines specific requirements and obligations for the building owner or occupier to meet fire safety standards.
The order may specify actions such as installing fire safety equipment, conducting regular inspections, and implementing fire safety measures.
It aims to protect the occupants of the building and prevent fire hazards.
The order is enforceable by law, and failure to comply may result in penalties or legal consequences.
It is an important document for maintaining fire safety standards and ensuring the safety of the building and its occupants.

它是根據《消防安全（建築物）條例（第572章）》第6(1)條發出的合法命令。
該命令涉及確保建築物的消防安全合規性。
它列明了建築物業主或佔用人需要遵守的具體要求和義務，以符合消防安全標準。
命令可能包括安裝消防設備、進行定期檢查和實施消防措施等行動。
目的是保護建築物的居民，預防火災危險。
該命令具有法律約束力，不遵守可能導致處罰或法律後果。
它是維護消防安全標準並確保建築物及其居民安全的重要文件。
This type of document is an official order issued under the Fire Safety (Buildings) Ordinance (Chapter 572) requiring compliance with fire safety regulations for the property.
這種文件是根據《消防安全（建築物）條例》（第572章）發出的官方命令，要求該物業遵守消防安全規定。
FIRST CHARGE:
It is a legal claim or lien placed on a property.
The first charge refers to the highest-ranking priority among all the charges or mortgages registered against a property.
It means that the holder of the first charge has the first right to claim proceeds from the sale of the property in case of default or foreclosure.
The first charge holder is typically a lender who provided the primary loan or mortgage on the property.
It provides the first level of security and protection for the lender's investment.
If the property is sold, the proceeds from the sale will first be used to satisfy the debt owed to the first charge holder before other creditors or subsequent charges are paid.
The first charge is an important consideration for lenders and borrowers in assessing the priority of their respective interests in a property.

這是對一個財產的法律索賠或抵押權。
第一順位抵押是指在所有已登記的抵押或貸款中，優先權最高的抵押權。
這意味著持有第一順位抵押權的人在財產拖欠或被查封時，有優先權首先要求財產出售的收益。
第一順位抵押權持有人通常是提供該財產主要貸款或抵押貸款的貸方。
它為貸方的投資提供第一級的安全和保護。
如果財產被出售，出售收益將首先用於償還欠第一順位抵押權持有人的債務，然後再支付其他債權人或後續抵押權。
第一順位抵押權是貸方和借方評估各自對財產權益的優先次序時的重要考慮因素。
This type of document refers to a legal claim or mortgage that has the highest priority over other charges or mortgages on a property.
這種文件指的是對一個財產具有最高優先權的法律索賠或抵押權。
FIRST EQUITABLE MORTGAGE:
This refers to a legal claim or mortgage over a property.
A first equitable mortgage is the highest-ranking mortgage in a series of registered mortgages or loans.
It means that the holder of the first equitable mortgage has the highest priority in claiming the proceeds from the property in case of default or foreclosure.
The first equitable mortgage holder is typically the lender who provided the primary loan or mortgage on the property.
It provides the lender with the first level of security and protection for their investment.
If the property is sold, the proceeds from the sale will first be used to repay the debt owed to the holder of the first equitable mortgage before paying other creditors or subsequent mortgages.
The first equitable mortgage is an important consideration for both the lender and the borrower when assessing their respective priority of interest in the property.

這是指對房地產的法律權利或抵押權。
第一順位公平抵押是一系列已登記抵押或貸款中最高級別的抵押權。
這意味著第一順位公平抵押權持有人在違約或查封情況下優先於其他人對該物業的處分權。
第一順位公平抵押權持有人通常是為該物業提供主要貸款或抵押貸款的貸方。
它為貸方提供了對其投資的最高級別的安全和保護。
如果物業被出售，首先將用出售所得償還欠第一順位公平抵押權持有人的債務，然後再支付其他債權人或後續抵押貸款。
第一順位公平抵押權在貸方和借方評估其在物業中的相對利益優先順序時至關重要。
This type of document refers to a legally registered mortgage that grants the lender the first priority claim on the property in case of default or foreclosure.
「這類文件」指的是在法律上註冊的抵押貸款，它賦予貸方在違約或強制執行的情況下對該物業的優先權索償。
FIRST LEGAL CHARGE:
It refers to a legal document that establishes the highest-ranking security interest or mortgage on a property.
A first legal charge is the highest priority charge in a series of registered charges or loans.
It means that the holder of the first legal charge has priority over others in terms of rights to the property in case of default or foreclosure.
The holder of the first legal charge is typically the lender who provided the primary loan or mortgage on the property.
It provides the lender with the highest level of security and protection for their investment.
If the property is sold, the proceeds will first be used to repay the debt owed to the holder of the first legal charge before paying other creditors or subsequent mortgage loans.
The first legal charge is crucial for both the lender and the borrower in assessing the relative priority of their interests in the property.

它是指一份法律文件，用於建立對某項房產的最高級別的擔保權或抵押權。
首要法律負擔是一系列已登記的擔保或貸款中具有最高優先權的負擔。
這意味著在發生拖欠或查封情況下，首要法律負擔持有人享有對該房產的優先權。
首要法律負擔持有人通常是提供該房產主要貸款或抵押貸款的貸方。
它為貸方提供了對其投資的最高級別的安全和保護。
如果該房產被出售，首先將用於償還歸首要法律負擔持有人的債務，然後才是支付其他債權人或後續抵押貸款。
首要法律負擔對於貸方和借方都非常重要，用於評估他們在該房產中的利益相對優先級。
This type of document refers to a registered legal charge that grants the lender a first priority claim over the property in case of default or enforcement.
此類文件指的是一項已註冊的法律負擔，授予貸方對該物業的優先索償權，在違約或執行時享有第一優先權。
FIRST LEGAL CHARGE/MORTGAGE:
It is a legal document that establishes the highest level of security or mortgage over a property.
A first legal charge/mortgage is the highest-ranking charge or mortgage among a series of registered securities or loans.
This means that in case of default or foreclosure, the holder of the first legal charge/mortgage has priority over the property.
The holder of the first legal charge/mortgage is typically the lender who provides the primary loan or mortgage on the property.
It provides the lender with the highest level of security and protection for their investment.
If the property is sold, the proceeds will first be used to repay the debt owed to the holder of the first legal charge/mortgage, before other creditors or subsequent mortgages are paid.
The first legal charge/mortgage is important for both the lender and the borrower in assessing their relative priority of interests in the property.

它是一份法律文件，用於在土地註冊中建立最高級別的擔保或抵押權。
首次法律負擔/抵押是一系列已註冊的擔保或貸款中最優先的擔保或抵押權。
這意味著在拖欠或處理抵押品時，首次法律負擔/抵押權持有人具有優先權。
首次法律負擔/抵押權持有人通常是提供該物業主要貸款或抵押貸款的貸方。
它為貸方提供了對其投資的最高級別的安全和保護。
如果該物業被出售，首次法律負擔/抵押權持有人將優先償還所欠負債，然後才是其他債權人或後續抵押貸款的償還。
首次法律負擔/抵押權對於貸方和借方都很重要，以評估他們在物業中的相對利益優先順序。
This type of document refers to a registered legal encumbrance that grants the lender a priority claim on the property, giving them the first right of repayment in case of default or enforcement.
這種文件指的是一項登記的法律負擔，授予貸款人對該財產的優先索償權，以便在違約或強制執行的情況下首先獲得償還的權利。
FOURTH MORTGAGE:
It is a legal document that represents the fourth level of mortgage or charge registered against a property in the land registry.
A fourth mortgage indicates that there are three prior mortgages or charges already registered against the property.
The holder of the fourth mortgage has a lower priority compared to the holders of the first, second, and third mortgages.
In the event of default or foreclosure, the proceeds from the property's sale would first go towards satisfying the obligations of the first, second, and third mortgage holders before reaching the fourth mortgage holder.
Fourth mortgages typically have higher risks for lenders, as they are further down the priority ladder and may have limited or no funds left to satisfy their debt.
Borrowers obtaining a fourth mortgage may face challenges due to the existing higher-ranking mortgages, making it harder to secure favorable loan terms.
It is crucial for lenders and borrowers to consider the existing mortgage hierarchy and potential risks associated with fourth mortgages.

這是一份法律文件，代表著在土地註冊處登記的第四級抵押或權利設定。
第四次抵押意味著該財產已經有三項先前的抵押或權利設定已在註冊中。
第四次抵押持有人的優先順序較低，相較於第一、第二和第三次抵押持有人。
在違約或強制執行的情況下，賣出該財產所獲得的款項將首先用於償還第一、第二和第三次抵押持有人的債務，然後才能支付給第四次抵押持有人。
第四次抵押對貸方而言通常具有較高風險，因為他們在優先順序上處於較低的位置，可能只剩下有限或沒有資金來償還債務。
獲得第四次抵押的借款人可能面臨挑戰，因為現有的高級抵押使得更難獲得有利的貸款條件。
對於貸方和借款方來說，考慮現有的抵押順位和第四次抵押可能存在的風險非常重要。

This type of document refers to a mortgage that is ranked fourth in priority among multiple mortgages registered against a property. It indicates the order of repayment in case of default or foreclosure.
這種文件是指在多個抵押貸款中，排名第四位的抵押貸款。它表示在違約或被處置的情況下，償還款順序的先後。
FURTHER CHARGE:
It is a legal document that represents an additional charge or mortgage registered under the land registry.
A further charge is created when the property already has an existing charge or mortgage registered and the owner wishes to create an additional charge on the property.
The further charge holder will have a lower priority compared to the holders of the existing charges or mortgages.
In the event of default or foreclosure, the proceeds from the sale of the property will be used to repay the debts of the existing charge holders before being allocated to the further charge holder.
The creation of a further charge allows the property owner to secure additional financing using the property as collateral.
The terms and conditions of the further charge will be outlined in the legal document, including the repayment terms and any additional obligations of the property owner.
It is important for both the further charge holder and the property owner to understand the implications and risks associated with the further charge.

這是一份在土地註冊處登記的附加抵押或貸款的法律文件。
當房產已經存在一個已登記的抵押或貸款，並且所有者希望在該房產上再建立一個額外的抵押或貸款時，就會產生附加抵押。
附加抵押的優先順序較低，相較於現有的抵押或貸款持有人。
在違約或處分時，房產的銷售收益將首先用於償還現有抵押或貸款持有人的債務，然後才分配給附加抵押持有人。
通過建立附加抵押，房產所有者可以利用該房產作為擔保來獲得額外的融資。
附加抵押的條款和條件將在法律文件中詳細說明，包括償還條款和所有者的其他義務。
對於附加抵押持有人和房產所有者來說，了解附加抵押的影響和風險非常重要。
This type of document refers to an additional charge registered on a property that already has an existing mortgage or charge. It ranks below the existing charge in terms of repayment priority.
這種文件是指在已存在抵押或負擔的財產上註冊的額外負擔。它在還款優先順序上位於現有負擔之下。
GOVERNMENT NOTICE:
It is an official notice issued by the government.
It contains important information or announcements related to land and property matters.
Government notices can cover a wide range of topics, such as land zoning, land acquisition, development plans, or property regulations.
These notices are typically published in government gazettes or other official publications.
They serve as a means of communication between the government and the public regarding land and property-related matters.
Government notices may include changes in land use policies, new regulations or requirements, public hearings, or upcoming projects.
It is important for individuals and organizations involved in land and property to stay informed about government notices as they may affect their rights, obligations, or future plans.

這是政府發出的官方通知。
內容涉及土地和財產事務的重要訊息或公告。
政府通知可以涵蓋各種主題，例如土地劃分、土地徵收、發展計劃或財產法規。
這些通知通常刊登在政府公報或其他官方刊物上。
它們作為政府與公眾之間就土地和財產事務進行溝通的手段。
政府通知可能包括土地使用政策的變更、新的法規或要求、公眾聽證會或即將進行的項目等。
對於涉及土地和財產的個人和組織來說，及時了解政府通知的內容非常重要，因為這可能影響到他們的權益、義務或未來計劃。
This type of document refers to an official notice issued by the government, containing information, regulations, or instructions related to the property or its surrounding area.
這類文件是指由政府發出的官方通知，其中包含與該物業或其周邊地區相關的信息、規定或指示。
IRREVOCABLE POWER OF ATTORNEY:
A legally binding document granting someone the authority to act on behalf of another person in specific matters related to land or property.
The power of attorney is irrevocable, meaning it cannot be revoked or withdrawn by the person who granted it.
It gives the appointed person the power to make decisions, sign documents, and enter into transactions regarding the specified land or property.
The power of attorney may be granted for various purposes, such as buying or selling property, managing rental income, or dealing with legal disputes.
The appointed person has a legal duty to act in the best interests of the grantor and fulfill their responsibilities with diligence and care.
The irrevocable power of attorney provides a mechanism for efficient and effective management of land and property matters in the absence or incapacity of the grantor.
It is important to carefully consider and select a trustworthy and competent person as the attorney, as they will have significant decision-making authority over the land or property.

一份具有法律約束力的文件，授予某人代表他人處理與土地或財產有關的特定事項的權力。
授權書是不可撤銷的，表示授權人無法撤回或撤銷此權力。
它賦予被指派的人在指定土地或財產事務上作出決定、簽署文件和進行交易的權力。
授權書可以出於不同的目的而授予，例如買賣房產、管理租金收入或處理法律糾紛。
被指派的人有法律義務以授權人的最佳利益行事，並以認真和謹慎的態度履行職責。
不可撤銷的授權書為在授權人缺席或無能力時，提供了一種高效管理土地和財產事務的機制。
選擇一個值得信賴且能力出眾的人作為代理人非常重要，因為他們將對土地或財產擁有重要的決策權力。
This type of document grants someone the authority to act on behalf of the property owner, and it cannot be revoked or cancelled without the consent of all parties involved.
「不可撤銷的授權書」授予某人代表房產擁有人行事的權力，該授權書不能在未經所有相關方的同意下被撤銷或取消。
LEGAL CHARGE:
A legal document that creates a security interest over a property to secure a debt or obligation.
It is a form of mortgage or lien that gives the lender the right to claim the property if the borrower fails to repay the debt.
The legal charge is registered at the land registry to provide notice to third parties about the lender's interest in the property.
It outlines the terms and conditions of the loan, including the amount borrowed, interest rate, repayment schedule, and any additional provisions.
The legal charge grants the lender certain rights, such as the power to sell the property to recover the debt in case of default.
It provides a legal framework for the lender to enforce its rights and interests in the property.
The legal charge is an important document in property transactions, ensuring the lender's security and protecting their financial investment.

一份法律文件，用於在土地註冊處建立對財產的安全利益，以保證債務或義務的履行。
它是一種按揭或留置權的形式，如果借款人未能償還債務，貸款人有權要求該財產。
法律抵押負責在土地註冊處登記，以通知第三方貸款人對財產的利益。
法律抵押文件中詳細列出貸款的條款和條件，包括借款金額、利率、還款計劃和其他相關規定。
法律抵押賦予貸款人特定的權利，例如在借款人違約情況下，有權出售該財產以償還債務。
它為貸款人提供了執行其在該財產中的權益和權利的法律框架。
法律抵押是房地產交易中的重要文件，確保貸款人的安全，保護他們的投資。
This type of document is a "法律負擔"，它確保對該財產的擁有者設立擔保權，以作為債務的保證或抵押品。
這類文件是一份「法律負擔」，它確保對該財產的擁有者設立擔保權，以作為債務的保證或抵押品。
LEGAL CHARGE/MORTGAGE:
A legal document establishing a secured interest in a property at the Land Registry, ensuring the fulfillment of a debt or obligation.
It is a form of mortgage or lien where the lender has the right to claim the property if the borrower fails to repay the debt.
The legal charge/mortgage is registered at the Land Registry to notify third parties of the lender's interest in the property.
The document outlines the terms and conditions of the loan in detail, including the loan amount, interest rate, repayment schedule, and other relevant provisions.
The legal charge/mortgage grants specific rights to the lender, such as the ability to sell the property to repay the debt in case of borrower default.
It provides a legal framework for the lender to enforce their interests and rights in the property.
The legal charge/mortgage is an important document in real estate transactions, ensuring the lender's security and protecting their investment.

一份在土地註冊處確立對財產擁有有保障利益的法律文件，以確保債務或義務的履行。
它是一種抵押或留置權形式，借款人未能償還債務時，貸款人有權要求該財產。
法律抵押/按揭在土地註冊處登記，通知第三方貸款人對該財產的利益。
該文件詳細列出了貸款的條款和條件，包括貸款金額、利率、還款計劃和其他相關條款。
法律抵押/按揭授予貸款人特定的權利，如在借款人違約的情況下有權出售該財產以償還債務。
它為貸款人在財產中執行其利益和權利提供了法律框架。
法律抵押/按揭是房地產交易中的重要文件，確保貸款人的安全並保護他們的投資。
This type of document is a legal instrument that establishes a lender's interest in a property as security for a loan or debt.
這類文件是一種法律工具，用於確立借款人將其財產作為貸款或債務的擔保物的擁有權。
LETTER FOR REMOVAL OF ALIENATION RESTRIC:
A letter issued by the land registry to remove alienation restrictions on a property.
Alienation restrictions refer to limitations on the transfer or disposal of the property.
The letter signifies that the restrictions imposed on the property's transfer have been lifted.
It allows the property owner to freely sell, mortgage, or transfer ownership without any hindrances.
The letter serves as proof that the property is no longer subject to any legal limitations on its transferability.
It provides assurance to potential buyers or lenders that the property can be freely dealt with.
The letter is an important document in property transactions, ensuring the property owner's rights and facilitating smooth transfers.

土地註冊處發出的一封信函，用於移除對產權轉移的限制。
這些限制被稱為轉讓限制，限制了該物業的轉讓或處置。
這封信函表示對該物業轉讓的限制已被解除。
它允許產權擁有人自由出售、抵押或轉讓所有權，不受任何阻礙。
這封信函證明該物業不再受到任何法律上的轉讓限制。
對於潛在的買家或貸款人來說，這封信函提供了該物業可以自由處置的保證。
這封信函是房地產交易中的重要文件，確保產權擁有人的權益，促進順利的產權轉移。
This type of document is a letter issued to remove the restrictions on the transfer or sale of the property imposed by previous agreements or legal provisions.
這類文件是一封用於解除對財產轉讓或出售所加以限制的前述協議或法律規定的信函。
LETTER OF COMPLIANCE:
A letter issued by the land registry to confirm compliance with certain requirements or regulations.
It serves as proof that the property or land in question meets the necessary legal standards.
The letter of compliance may be obtained for various purposes, such as building construction, zoning regulations, or environmental compliance.
It signifies that the property has satisfied all the specified criteria and is in accordance with the applicable laws and regulations.
This letter is often required during property transactions or when applying for permits or licenses.
It assures the parties involved that the property has been assessed and found to be compliant with the relevant regulations.
The letter of compliance helps ensure transparency and legal compliance in land and property matters.

土地註冊處發出的一封信函，用於確認符合特定要求或法規的標準。
這封信函作為該物業或土地滿足必要法律標準的證明。
可以為了不同目的獲得合規性信函，例如建築施工、分區法規或環境合規性。
它表示該物業已經符合所有指定標準，並符合適用的法律和法規。
在物業交易或申請許可證或牌照時，通常需要這封合規性信函。
它向相關各方保證該物業已經經過評估，符合相關法規。
合規性信函有助於確保土地和物業事務的透明度和法律合規性。
This type of document is a letter issued to confirm that the property complies with certain regulations, requirements, or standards set by the relevant authority.
這種文件是一封發出的信函，用於確認該房產符合相關當局設定的某些法規、要求或標準。
LETTER OF NOMINATION:
A letter issued by the land registry to nominate a person or entity as the legal representative or nominee for a property or land.
It establishes the appointed individual or entity as the authorized representative for administrative and legal purposes.
The letter of nomination is typically used when there is a change in ownership or a need to designate a representative for a property.
It confirms the legal status and authority of the nominated person or entity to act on behalf of the property owner.
The letter of nomination may include details such as the nominee's name, contact information, and the scope of their authority.
It is an important document for establishing the rights and responsibilities of the nominated party in relation to the property.
The letter of nomination serves as official recognition of the designated individual or entity's role in managing and handling property-related matters.

地政署發出的一封信函，用於指定某人或實體作為財產或土地的合法代表或提名人。
它確立了指定的個人或實體作為財產的授權代表，以進行行政和法律事務。
通常在產權變更或需要為財產指定代表時使用信函。
它確認指定的個人或實體在財產所有者名下有法律地位和權限。
信函可能包含提名人的姓名、聯繫信息和其權限範圍等詳細信息。
這是確立指定個人或實體在管理和處理與財產有關事務方面的權益和責任的重要文件。
信函的提名確認了指定個人或實體在財產相關事務中的角色，具有官方認可的地位。
This type of document is a letter that designates or nominates a specific individual or entity to assume a particular role or responsibility in relation to the property.
這種文件是一封指定或提名特定個人或實體擔任與該財產相關的特定角色或責任的信函。
LETTER OF REMOVAL OF ALIENATION RESTRICT:
A letter issued by the land registry to remove the restrictions on the alienation or transfer of property.
It is a document that allows the owner of the property to freely transfer or sell it without any legal limitations or restrictions.
The letter confirms that the previous restrictions on the property have been lifted or removed.
It provides evidence that the property can now be transferred or sold without any hindrance.
The letter may contain details such as the property address, owner's information, and the date of the removal of the alienation restrictions.
It is an important document for property owners who wish to transfer or sell their property without any restrictions.
The letter signifies that the property is free from any encumbrances or limitations on its transferability.

土地註冊處發出的信函，用於解除對財產轉讓的限制。
這是一份文件，允許財產所有人自由轉讓或出售該財產，沒有任何法律限制或限制。
這封信函確認先前對該財產的限制已被解除。
它提供了證據，證明該財產現在可以自由轉讓或出售，沒有任何阻礙。
信函可能包含詳細信息，如財產地址、所有者資訊以及解除轉讓限制的日期。
對於希望在沒有任何限制的情況下轉讓或出售其財產的財產所有人來說，這是一份重要的文件。
該信函表示該財產沒有任何負擔或轉讓能力的限制。
This type of document is a letter that confirms the removal of any restrictions on the transfer or sale of the property to non-citizens or non-residents.
這類文件是一封確認解除對非公民或非居民轉讓或出售該財產的限制的信函。
LETTER OF WITHDRAWAL:
A letter issued by the land registry to withdraw a previous document or application related to a property.
It is a formal correspondence indicating the cancellation or withdrawal of a specific request or document.
The letter serves as official confirmation that the previous document or application is no longer in effect or valid.
It may include details such as the reference number, date of the withdrawn document/application, and the reason for withdrawal.
The purpose of the letter is to update the land registry records and inform relevant parties about the withdrawal.
The letter of withdrawal ensures that the previous document or application will not have any legal effect or impact on the property.
It is an important document in maintaining accurate and up-to-date land registry records.

土地註冊處發出的一封信函，用於撤回與某個物業相關的先前文件或申請。
這是一封正式的信函，表示特定請求或文件已被取消或撤回。
信函作為官方確認，先前的文件或申請已不再有效或有效。
它可能包括參考編號、撤回文件/申請的日期以及撤回的原因等詳細信息。
信函的目的是更新土地註冊處的記錄，並通知相關方關於撤回的情況。
撤回信函確保先前的文件或申請對物業不會產生任何法律影響。
這是保持準確和最新的土地註冊處記錄的重要文件。
This type of document is a letter issued to formally withdraw a previously submitted request or application related to the property.
這類文件是一封正式發出的信函，用於撤回先前提交的與該房產相關的請求或申請。
LETTERS OF ADMINISTRATION:
Official legal documents issued by the land registry to appoint an administrator to manage the estate of a deceased person.
These letters grant legal authority to the administrator to handle the assets, debts, and distribution of the deceased's estate.
They are issued when the deceased person did not leave a valid will or when the appointed executor is unable or unwilling to act.
The letters of administration establish the administrator's legal status and responsibilities in administering the estate.
They may include details such as the name of the deceased, the appointed administrator, and the date of appointment.
The purpose of the letters of administration is to ensure proper management and distribution of the deceased's estate according to applicable laws and regulations.
These documents play a crucial role in resolving legal matters related to the deceased person's assets and properties.

地政署發出的正式法律文件，用於任命一名管理人來處理已故人士的遺產事務。
這些信函授予管理人合法權力，以處理已故人士的資產、債務和分配事宜。
當已故人士沒有留下有效的遺囑，或指定的執行人無法或不願履行職務時，將發出這些信函。
信函授予管理人在處理遺產事務方面的法律地位和責任。
信函可能包括已故人士的姓名、指定的管理人和任命日期等詳細信息。
信函的目的是根據相應的法律和法規，確保已故人士的遺產得到妥善管理和分配。
這些文件在解決與已故人士的資產和財產有關的法律問題方面起著至關重要的作用。
This type of document is a legal document issued by the court to authorize a person to administer the estate of a deceased individual.
這類文件是由法院發出的法律文件，授權一個人管理已故個人的財產。
LETTERS OF ADMINISTRATION DE BONIS NON:
A legal document issued by the Land Registry appointing an administrator to handle the unfinished estate matters of a deceased person.
These letters are granted when the previous administrator is unable or unwilling to complete their duties, or when there is no appointed administrator.
The purpose of these letters is to appoint a new administrator, known as the administrator de bonis non, to handle the remaining assets, debts, and distribution of the estate.
The administrator de bonis non assumes the legal responsibility and authority to manage and distribute the assets of the deceased person's estate.
The letters may include details such as the name of the deceased person, the appointed administrator de bonis non, and the date of appointment.
These documents play a crucial role in resolving legal issues related to the assets and properties of the deceased person's estate.

土地註冊處發出的法律文件，任命一位行政人員處理已故人士未完成的遺產事項。
當前任行政人員無法或不願完成職責，或者沒有任命行政人員時，將授予這些信函。
這些信函的目的是任命新的行政人員，即"de bonis non"行政人員，處理剩餘的資產、債務和遺產分配事宜。
"de bonis non"行政人員承擔法律責任和權力，管理並分配已故人士遺產的資產。
這些信函可能包含已故人士的姓名、任命的"de bonis non"行政人員以及任命日期等詳細信息。
這些文件在解決與已故人士遺產的資產和財產有關的法律問題方面起著重要作用。
This type of document is issued by the court to appoint an administrator to manage the remaining assets of a deceased person's estate that were not previously administered.
此類文件是由法院發出，委任一名管理員來管理已故人士的遺產中尚未處理的資產。
LOAN AGREEMENT:
An agreement between a lender and a borrower that outlines the terms and conditions of a loan for a property transaction.
It is a legally binding document that specifies the loan amount, interest rate, repayment schedule, and other relevant details.
The loan agreement may also include provisions regarding default, prepayment penalties, and the rights and responsibilities of both parties.
This document is used in the context of property transactions and is typically registered with the land registry to establish the lender's interest in the property.
It provides a legal framework for the loan transaction, ensuring that both parties understand their obligations and rights.
The loan agreement serves as evidence of the loan and can be used for reference or enforcement in case of disputes or non-compliance with the agreed terms.

貸款協議是借款人與貸款人之間的一份協議，規定了房地產交易中貸款的條款和條件。
這是一份具有法律約束力的文件，明確規定了貸款金額、利率、還款計劃和其他相關細節。
貸款協議可能還包括有關違約、提前還款罰款以及雙方權利和責任的條款。
此文件在房地產交易中使用，通常會向土地註冊處註冊，以確定貸款人對該房產的利益。
它為貸款交易提供了法律框架，確保雙方了解其義務和權利。
貸款協議作為貸款的證據，可以在爭議或未履行協議條款的情況下作為參考或執行依據。

This type of document outlines the terms and conditions of a loan between a lender and a borrower, including the loan amount, interest rate, repayment terms, and any collateral or guarantees involved.
這類文件概述了貸款方與借款方之間的貸款條款和條件，包括貸款金額、利率、還款方式，以及涉及的任何擔保品或保證。
MEMORANDUM FOR SALE AND PURCHASE:
A Memorandum for Sale and Purchase is a document that records the agreement between the buyer and seller in a real estate transaction.
It outlines the essential terms and conditions of the sale, including the property details, purchase price, payment terms, and any special conditions or contingencies.
This document serves as evidence of the intention to buy and sell the property, providing clarity and protection for both parties involved.
The Memorandum for Sale and Purchase is typically prepared and signed before the formal contract is executed, serving as a preliminary agreement.
It may be lodged with the land registry to establish a record of the transaction and protect the interests of the parties involved.
This document can be referred to in case of disputes or as a reference for the formalization of the sale and purchase agreement.

「購售備忘錄」是一份記錄買方和賣方在房地產交易中的協議的文件。
該文件概述了銷售的基本條款和條件，包括物業詳情、購買價格、付款條款以及任何特殊條件或附帶條款。
這份文件作為買賣雙方的意圖的證據，為雙方提供明確性和保護。
「購售備忘錄」通常在正式合同簽署之前準備和簽署，作為初步協議。
它可以在土地註冊處登記，以確立交易的記錄並保護當事方的利益。
在爭議或正式購售合同的制定過程中，可以參考此文件。
This type of document outlines the terms and conditions of a property sale and purchase agreement, including the parties involved, the purchase price, and any relevant conditions or contingencies.
這種文件概述了買賣協議的條款和條件，包括涉及的各方、購買價格以及任何相關的條件或條款。
MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT FOR SALE AND PUR:
A Memorandum of Agreement for Sale and Purchase is a document that outlines the terms and conditions of a property transaction between a buyer and a seller.
It serves as a preliminary agreement before the formal contract is prepared and signed.
The document includes important details such as property information, purchase price, payment terms, and any special or additional conditions.
It is a legally binding document that establishes the intentions and agreement between the parties involved in the transaction.
The Memorandum of Agreement for Sale and Purchase can be used as evidence of the transaction and provides clarity and protection for both the buyer and the seller.
It is commonly prepared and signed prior to the formal registration of the transaction with the land registry.
This document can be referred to during disputes or in the process of drafting the formal sale and purchase agreement.

買賣協議備忘錄是一份文件，記錄了買方和賣方之間房地產交易的條款和條件。
這份文件在正式合約簽署之前作為初步協議。
文件包含重要細節，如物業資訊、購買價格、付款條款和任何特殊或額外條件。
它是一份具有法律約束力的文件，確立了交易各方的意向和協議。
買賣協議備忘錄可作為交易的證據，為買方和賣方提供明確性和保護。
通常在正式將交易註冊於地政署之前，會預先準備並簽署該備忘錄。
在爭議或起草正式買賣協議的過程中，可以參考該文件。
This type of document outlines the terms and conditions of the sale and purchase agreement, including the involved parties, purchase price, and any relevant conditions or clauses.
這種文件詳細說明了買賣協議的條款和條件，包括相關的各方、購買價格以及任何相關條件或條款。
MEMORANDUM OF CHARGE:
A Memorandum of Charge is a legal document that establishes a charge or lien on a property in favor of a creditor.
It is used to record and protect the creditor's interest in the property.
The document outlines the details of the debt, including the amount owed, the interest rate, and the repayment terms.
It serves as evidence of the creditor's claim on the property and can be used in legal proceedings if necessary.
The Memorandum of Charge is typically registered with the land registry to provide notice to other parties.
It creates a legal obligation on the property owner to repay the debt and prevents the property from being sold or transferred without the creditor's consent.
The document may also include provisions for enforcement or remedies in case of default.
It is an important document for both the creditor and the property owner to establish and protect their respective rights.

負擔備忘錄是一份法律文件，用於確立債權人對財產的抵押或留置權。
這份文件用於記錄和保護債權人在財產上的利益。
文件詳細說明債務的細節，包括欠款金額、利率和還款條款。
它作為債權人對財產的主張證據，必要時可用於法律訴訟。
負擔備忘錄通常在土地註冊處註冊，以提供對其他當事人的通知。
它創建了對財產所有人的法律義務，要求其償還債務，並防止未經債權人同意出售或轉讓財產。
該文件還可能包括有關違約情況下的執行或救濟措施的條款。
它對債權人和財產所有人來說都是重要的文件，用於確立和保護各自的權益。
This type of document is a record of a charge registered against a property, outlining the details of the charge, such as the amount owed and the rights and obligations of the parties involved.
這類文件是對一項財產註冊的負擔的記錄，概述了負擔的詳細資料，例如欠款金額和涉及方的權利和義務。
MEMORANDUM OF DETERMINATION:
A Memorandum of Determination is a legal document used to record a decision or ruling made by a court or an arbitrator.
It outlines the details and outcome of a dispute resolution process related to a property or land.
The document serves as an official record of the resolution, providing clarity and finality to the parties involved.
It may include information such as the names of the parties, a summary of the dispute, the decision reached, and any associated terms or conditions.
The Memorandum of Determination helps to establish the rights and obligations of the parties involved, providing a basis for future actions or agreements.
It is an important document in the land registry as it helps to ensure the proper documentation and recording of legal decisions related to properties.
The document may be relied upon by the parties, as well as future buyers, lenders, or other interested parties, as evidence of the resolution reached.

「確定備忘錄」是一份法律文件，用於記錄法院或仲裁人對爭議的裁決或判決。
它概述了與財產或土地相關的爭議解決過程的細節和結果。
該文件作為官方的解決紀錄，為參與方提供了明確性和最終性。
它可能包括參與方的名稱、爭議的摘要、達成的決定以及相關的條款或條件。
「確定備忘錄」有助於確立參與方的權利和義務，為未來的行動或協議提供了基礎。
在土地登記中，該文件是重要的，因為它有助於確保財產相關法律決策的適當文件化和記錄。
參與方以及未來的買家、貸款人或其他相關方可以依賴該文件作為解決的證據。
This type of document is a record of a decision or judgment made by an authorized entity regarding a property-related matter, such as ownership rights or dispute resolution.
這種文件是有關財產相關事項的決定或判決的記錄，例如所有權權利或爭議解決。
MEMORANDUM OF DISCHARGE:
A "Memorandum of Discharge" is a legal document used to record the release or discharge of a mortgage or charge on a property.
It signifies that the mortgage or charge has been fully repaid or satisfied, and the property is no longer encumbered by the debt.
The document typically includes details such as the names of the parties involved, the property description, the date of discharge, and any relevant reference numbers.
The Memorandum of Discharge serves as evidence that the mortgage or charge has been legally released and provides clarity regarding the property's ownership status.
It is an important document in land registry records as it ensures the accurate documentation and public record of the mortgage discharge.
The Memorandum of Discharge may be required for future property transactions, refinancing, or to demonstrate the clear title of the property.

「解除備忘錄」是一份法律文件，用於記錄在土地註冊中解除或清償抵押或負擔物權的情況。
它表示該抵押或負擔已完全還清或清償，該財產不再受到債務的限制。
該文件通常包括各方的名稱、財產描述、解除日期和相關的參考號碼等詳細信息。
「解除備忘錄」作為證據證明抵押或負擔已經合法解除，並提供關於財產所有權狀態的明確性。
它在土地註冊記錄中是一份重要文件，確保抵押解除的準確記錄和公開記錄。
「解除備忘錄」可能需要在未來的財產交易、再融資或證明財產清晰所有權時使用。
This type of document is a record indicating the release or discharge of a mortgage or charge on a property.
這類文件是一份記錄，表示對財產上的抵押或負擔的解除或清除。
MEMORANDUM OF RELEASE:
A Memorandum of Release is a legal document used to record the release or discharge of a charge or encumbrance on a property under the land registry.
It signifies that the charge or encumbrance has been fully satisfied or released, and the property is no longer subject to the associated debt or restriction.
The document typically includes details such as the names of the parties involved, property description, release date, and relevant reference numbers.
The Memorandum of Release serves as evidence that the charge or encumbrance has been lawfully released and provides clarity on the status of property ownership.
It is an important document in the land registry records, ensuring accurate records and public documentation of the release of the charge.
The Memorandum of Release may be required for future property transactions, refinancing, or to prove clear ownership of the property.

釋放備忘錄是一份法律文件，用於在土地註冊處記錄解除或釋放負擔物或限制物對財產的影響。
這表示該負擔物或限制物已經完全清償或解除，該財產不再受到相關債務或限制的影響。
該文件通常包括相關各方的姓名、財產描述、解除日期和相關參考編號等詳細信息。
釋放備忘錄作為證據，表明負擔物或限制物已經合法解除，並明確財產所有權的狀態。
它是土地註冊紀錄中的重要文件，確保正確的記錄和公共文件化負擔物的解除。
釋放備忘錄可能在未來的財產交易、再融資或證明財產的清晰所有權時需要使用。
This type of document is a record that indicates the release or removal of a mortgage or encumbrance on the property.
這種文件是一份記錄，指示將貸款或負擔從該財產中解除或移除的文件。
MEMORANDUM OF SALE:
A Memorandum of Sale is a document used to record the sale of a property and its key details in the land registry.
It serves as evidence of the transaction and provides important information such as the parties involved, property description, sale price, and date of sale.
The Memorandum of Sale is typically signed by both the buyer and the seller, acknowledging the transfer of ownership.
It helps establish a legal record of the sale and provides clarity on the ownership status of the property.
The document may be required for future reference in property transactions, financing, or to establish a chain of ownership.
The Memorandum of Sale is an essential document in the land registry that ensures accurate recording and public documentation of property sales.

「銷售備忘錄」是一份用於記錄房地產銷售及其重要細節的文件，以在土地註冊處登記。
它作為交易的證據，提供重要信息，如涉及方、物業描述、售價和銷售日期。
「銷售備忘錄」通常由買方和賣方簽署，承認產權轉移。
它有助於建立銷售的法律紀錄，並提供物業所有權狀態的明確性。
該文件可能在未來的房地產交易、融資或確立產權鏈時需要。
「銷售備忘錄」是土地註冊中不可或缺的文件，確保對房地產銷售的準確記錄和公開文檔化。
This type of document is a written record that outlines the details and terms of a sale agreement for a property. It serves as evidence of the transaction.
這類文件是一份書面記錄，記錄了物業銷售協議的細節和條款。它作為交易的證據。
MEMORANDUM OF SALE AND PURCHASE:
A memorandum of sale and purchase is a document used to record the details of a real estate transaction for the purpose of registration at the land registry.
It serves as evidence of the transaction and includes essential information such as the parties involved, property description, purchase price, and the date of sale.
The memorandum is typically signed by both the buyer and seller, acknowledging the transfer of ownership.
It helps establish a legal record of the sale and provides clarity on the ownership status of the property.
The document may be required for future real estate transactions, financing, or establishing the chain of ownership.
The memorandum of sale and purchase is an essential document in the land registry, ensuring accurate records and documentation of the real estate sale.

「買賣備忘錄」是一份用於記錄不動產交易細節的文件，以便在土地註冊處進行登記。
它作為交易的證據，包括重要的信息，如交易雙方、物業描述、購買價格和交易日期。
通常由買方和賣方簽署，確認所有權的轉移。
這有助於建立交易的法律記錄，並清楚確定物業的所有權狀態。
該文件可能在未來的不動產交易、融資或建立所有權鏈時需要。
「買賣備忘錄」在土地註冊處是一份重要文件，確保不動產交易的準確記錄和文件化。
This type of document is a written record that outlines the details and terms of a property sale and purchase agreement. It serves as evidence of the transaction.
這類文件是一份書面記錄，詳細說明了買賣合約的細節和條款。它作為交易的證據。
MEMORANDUM OF SATISFACTION:
A Memorandum of Satisfaction is a document filed with the land registry to acknowledge the fulfillment of a mortgage or charge.
It serves as evidence that the debt secured by the mortgage or charge has been fully repaid or otherwise satisfied.
The memorandum includes details such as the parties involved, the property affected, the date of satisfaction, and any relevant reference numbers.
By filing this document, the land registry updates the records to reflect the discharge of the mortgage or charge on the property.
The Memorandum of Satisfaction provides assurance to potential buyers or lenders that the property is no longer encumbered by the previous mortgage or charge.
This document is crucial for maintaining an accurate and up-to-date land registry and ensuring transparency in property transactions.

滿意證書（Memorandum of Satisfaction）是一份提交給土地註冊處的文件，用於確認抵押貸款或負擔已經得到完全還清或滿足。
它作為證據，證明抵押貸款或負擔所擔保的債務已經完全還清或滿足。
該滿意證書包括相關各方的詳細信息，如涉及的財產、滿意日期和相關參考號等。
通過提交該文件，土地註冊處將更新記錄，以反映該財產上的抵押貸款或負擔已經解除。
滿意證書向潛在買家或貸款人提供保證，證明該財產不再受先前的抵押貸款或負擔的限制。
這份文件對於維護準確和最新的土地註冊記錄以及確保房地產交易的透明度至關重要。
This type of document is a written record that signifies the satisfaction or fulfillment of a previous obligation or condition, typically related to a mortgage or charge on a property.
這種文件是一份書面記錄，表示先前的負擔或條件已經滿足或履行，通常與貸款或抵押品有關。
MEMORIAL OF SATISFACTION UNDER S.33(10):
Memorial of Satisfaction under s.33(10) of the Buildings Ordinance is a document filed with the Land Registry to signify the completion of building works as required by the Buildings Ordinance.
It serves as evidence that the building works specified in the document have been completed in accordance with the requirements and regulations of the Buildings Ordinance.
The memorial includes details such as the property address, the date of completion, and any relevant reference numbers.
By filing this document, the Land Registry updates its records to reflect the satisfactory completion of the building works.
The memorial provides assurance to potential buyers or lenders that the building has been constructed in compliance with the relevant building regulations.
It plays a crucial role in maintaining accurate and up-to-date records at the Land Registry and ensuring transparency in property transactions.

根據《建築物條例》第33(10)條的規定，滿足紀念碑（Memorial of Satisfaction）是在土地註冊處提交的文件，用於標誌建築工程的完成。
這份文件作為證明，指示其中所述的建築工程已按照《建築物條例》的要求和規定完成。
紀念碑中包含詳細的資料，如物業地址、完成日期和相關參考編號。
通過提交這份文件，土地註冊處更新其記錄，以反映建築工程的滿意完成。
紀念碑向潛在買家或貸款人提供保證，證明建築物已按照相關建築法規建造。
它在土地註冊處中扮演著至關重要的角色，確保記錄準確並保持最新，同時在財產交易中確保透明度。
This type of document is a written record indicating that a previous obligation or condition specified under Section 33(10) of the Buildings Ordinance has been satisfied or fulfilled.
這種文件是一份書面記錄，表示根據《建築物條例》第33(10)條的規定，先前的義務或條件已被滿足或履行。
MORTGAGE:
A mortgage is a legal agreement between a borrower and a lender that is registered under the land registry.
It is a form of security for a loan where the borrower pledges their property as collateral.
The mortgage document outlines the terms and conditions of the loan, including the loan amount, interest rate, repayment schedule, and any additional provisions.
By registering the mortgage under the land registry, it creates a public record of the lender's interest in the property.
The mortgage gives the lender the right to take possession of the property and sell it if the borrower fails to repay the loan as agreed.
Once the mortgage is fully repaid, a discharge or release is typically filed with the land registry to remove the lender's interest from the property title.

抵押貸款是在土地註冊處註冊的借款人與貸款人之間的合法協議。
這是一種以借款人的財產作為擔保的貸款形式。
抵押貸款文件詳細說明了貸款的條款和條件，包括貸款金額、利率、還款計劃和任何其他條款。
通過在土地註冊處註冊抵押貸款，可以建立貸款人對該財產的利益的公開記錄。
抵押貸款給予貸款人在借款人未按照協議還款的情況下，有權佔有該財產並出售的權利。
一旦抵押貸款完全償還，通常會向土地註冊處提交解除抵押登記以從財產標題中刪除貸款人的利益。
This type of document is a legal agreement where the property is used as collateral for a loan, giving the lender the right to seize the property if the borrower fails to repay the loan.
這種文件是一份法律協議，其中財產被用作貸款的擔保物，借款人若未能償還貸款，貸款人有權收回該財產。
MORTGAGE DEED:
A mortgage deed is a legal document that establishes a mortgage loan and its terms between a borrower and a lender.
It outlines the details of the mortgage, including the loan amount, interest rate, repayment terms, and any additional conditions.
The mortgage deed is executed by the borrower and typically contains provisions related to the property being mortgaged.
It creates a lien on the property, allowing the lender to claim ownership if the borrower defaults on the loan.
The mortgage deed is often registered with the land registry to create a public record of the lender's interest in the property.
It serves as evidence of the mortgage agreement and provides security for the lender in case of default.

抵押契約是一份法律文件，在借款人和貸款人之間建立了一筆抵押貸款及其條款。
它詳細說明了抵押貸款的細節，包括貸款金額、利率、還款條件和任何其他條款。
抵押契約由借款人簽署，通常包含與抵押物有關的條款。
它在財產上創建了留置權，使得貸款人可以在借款人違約時對該財產主張所有權。
抵押契約通常在土地註冊處註冊，以建立貸款人對該財產的利益的公開記錄。
它作為抵押協議的證據，並為貸款人提供了在借款人違約時的保障。
This type of document is a legal agreement that outlines the terms and conditions of a mortgage, including the rights and responsibilities of the borrower and lender.
這類文件是一份法律協議，詳細說明了按揭的條款和條件，包括借款人和貸款人的權利和責任。
MORTGAGE TO SECURE GENERAL BANKING FACIL:
A mortgage to secure general banking facilities is a type of mortgage used to secure various banking facilities provided by a financial institution to a borrower.
It is a legal document that establishes a mortgage over the borrower's property to secure the repayment of general banking facilities such as loans, credit lines, or overdrafts.
The mortgage deed outlines the terms and conditions of the mortgage, including the amount of the facilities, interest rates, repayment terms, and any other relevant provisions.
By creating a mortgage, the lender obtains a legal interest in the property, allowing them to enforce their rights in case of default by the borrower.
This type of mortgage is typically registered at the land registry as a public record of the lender's interest in the property.
It provides security for the lender and serves as evidence of the borrower's obligations and the lender's rights in relation to the general banking facilities.

「抵押以擔保一般銀行業務」是一種抵押，用於擔保金融機構向借款人提供的各種銀行業務。
它是一份法律文件，確立了對借款人的財產設定抵押，以擔保一般銀行業務的還款，例如貸款、信用額度或透支。
抵押契約概述了抵押的條款和條件，包括業務金額、利率、還款條款和其他相關條款。
通過建立抵押，貸方獲得財產的法律利益，以便在借款人違約時行使其權利。
這類型的抵押通常在土地登記處登記，作為貸方在財產上的利益的公開記錄。
它為貸方提供安全性，並作為借款人的義務和貸方關於一般銀行業務的權利的證據。
This type of document is a mortgage that is used to secure general banking facilities provided by a financial institution against a property. It establishes a security interest for the bank.
此類文件是用於為銀行提供的一般銀行業務設定抵押品，以保護金融機構的權益。該文件確立了銀行的擔保權。
MORTGAGE/LEGAL CHARGE:
A mortgage/legal charge is a legal agreement between a borrower and a lender.
It is a form of security for a loan or debt where the borrower pledges their property as collateral.
The borrower grants the lender an interest in the property, which allows the lender to take possession or sell the property if the borrower fails to repay the loan.
The terms of the mortgage/legal charge include the loan amount, interest rate, repayment terms, and any additional conditions.
The mortgage/legal charge is usually registered with the land registry to create a public record of the lender's interest in the property.
It provides protection for the lender and establishes the borrower's obligation and the lender's rights regarding the loan or debt.

按揭/法定抵押是借款人與貸款人之間的一份法律協議。
這是一種貸款或債務的擔保形式，借款人將其財產作為抵押品。
借款人將財產的利益授予貸款人，如果借款人未能償還貸款，貸款人有權佔有或出售該財產。
按揭/法定抵押的條款包括貸款金額、利率、還款條件和任何附加條件。
按揭/法定抵押通常在土地登記處註冊，以建立貸款人對該財產的利益的公開記錄。
它為貸款人提供保護，確立了借款人對貸款或債務的義務和貸款人的權利。
This type of document is a legal agreement that establishes a lender's interest in a property as security for a loan or debt.
這種文件是一份法律協議，確定了貸款人對財產的利益，作為貸款或債務的擔保物品。
NO OBJECTION LETTER:
A No Objection Letter is a document issued by a relevant authority or entity.
It indicates that there are no objections or restrictions for a specific action or transaction related to a property.
It is often required when transferring ownership, obtaining permits, or making changes to the property.
The letter confirms that the authority or entity has reviewed the request and found it compliant with applicable regulations and requirements.
It may be issued by government agencies, homeowners' associations, or other relevant parties.
The No Objection Letter provides assurance to the recipient that they can proceed with the intended action without any legal or regulatory obstacles.

「無異議書」是由相關機構或實體發出的文件。
它表示在與房地產有關的特定行動或交易中，沒有任何異議或限制。
當進行產權轉移、獲取許可或對房地產進行變更時，通常需要此文件。
該文件確認相關機構或實體已審查要求並認為其符合相關法規和要求。
它可能由政府機構、住戶協會或其他相關方發出。
無異議書向收件人提供保證，表示他們可以在沒有任何法律或法規障礙的情況下繼續進行所打算的行動。
This type of document is a letter issued by a relevant authority indicating no objection to a specific action or transaction related to the property.
這類文件是由相關機構發出的信函，表示對與該物業相關的特定行動或交易沒有異議。
NOMINATION:
Nomination refers to the process of designating a person or entity as the intended recipient of a property or asset.
It is a legal mechanism that allows the owner of the property to specify who should inherit or take ownership of the property upon their death.
The nominated person or entity is often referred to as the nominee.
Nomination is commonly used in relation to properties held under the land registry.
It provides a means for the property owner to ensure a smooth transfer of ownership without the need for probate or legal proceedings.
The nomination can be made through a formal document or instrument that clearly outlines the nominated party.
The nominee will be recognized as the rightful owner of the property after the original owner's passing, subject to any applicable laws and regulations.

提名是指將某人或實體指定為財產或資產的預期接收者的過程。
這是一種法律機制，允許財產所有人在其去世後指定誰應該繼承或擁有該財產。
被提名的人或實體通常被稱為被提名人。
在土地登記下，提名是一種常用的方法。
它為財產所有人提供了一種方式，以確保在不需要遺囑認證或法律訴訟的情況下順利轉讓所有權。
提名可以通過正式文件或文件進行，清楚地說明被提名的一方。
在原所有人去世後，被提名人將被認定為該財產的合法所有人，但需遵守適用的法律和法規。
This type of document refers to the formal appointment of an individual or entity as the nominee or representative for a specific purpose or role related to the property.
「提名書」是指正式任命某人或實體為特定目的或與該財產相關的代表人或代表機構。
NOTICE OF SEVERANCE:
Notice of severance is a legal document used in property ownership to separate the joint tenancy between co-owners.
It is typically filed with the land registry to formally notify that a joint tenancy is being converted into a tenancy in common.
The notice effectively severs the unity of ownership, allowing each co-owner to have an individual share of the property.
By filing the notice, the co-owners indicate their intention to hold distinct and separate interests in the property.
It is an important step to protect the rights and interests of each co-owner and establish their independent ownership stakes.
The notice should include specific details such as the property address, names of the co-owners, and the date of severance.
Once the notice is registered, it becomes a legal record and establishes the new ownership structure of the property.

分割通知是一份在財產所有權中使用的法律文件，用於將共同租約的共同擁有權分割開來。
通常會向土地註冊處提交此通知，以正式通知將共同租約轉換為普通租約。
此通知有效地斷開了共同所有權的統一性，使每位共同擁有人能夠擁有該財產的獨立份額。
通過提交此通知，共同擁有人表明他們有意在財產中持有不同和獨立的權益。
此通知應該包括具體細節，如財產地址、共同擁有人的姓名和分割日期。
一旦通知被註冊，它就成為一個法律記錄，確立了該財產的新的所有權結構。
This type of document refers to a formal notice indicating the separation of joint tenancy, converting it into a tenancy in common for co-owners of a property.
這類文件指的是正式通知，表示將共同所有權分離，將其轉換為共有財產的財產所有權。
NOTICE OF SEVERANCE OF JOINT TENANCY:
Notice of Severance of Joint Tenancy is a legal document used in property ownership to sever the joint tenancy and create a tenancy in common.
It is typically submitted to the land registry to officially notify the change in ownership structure from joint tenancy to tenancy in common.
By serving this notice, the co-owners express their intention to hold separate and distinct shares in the property.
The notice should include specific details such as the property address, names of the co-owners, and the date of severance.
Once registered, the notice becomes a legal record and establishes the new ownership structure of the property.
Severing the joint tenancy allows each co-owner to have an individual and separate interest in the property.
This notice is important for clarifying and protecting the respective rights and interests of the co-owners in the property.

解除共同租約通知書是在產權所有權中使用的法律文件，用於解除共同租約並建立共同租約。
通常將其提交給土地註冊處，以正式通知從共同租約變更為共同租約的所有權結構。
通過提供這份通知，共有人表達了他們將在財產中持有分開且獨立份額的意願。
通知應包括具體的詳細信息，如物業地址、共有人姓名和解除日期。
一旦註冊，該通知成為法律記錄，確立了財產的新所有權結構。
解除共同租約使每個共有人能夠在財產中擁有個別和獨立的權益。
這份通知對於澄清和保護共有人在財產中的相應權益至關重要。
This type of document is a formal notice that signifies the termination of joint tenancy, converting it into a tenancy in common.
這種文件是一份正式通知，表示終止共同財產權，將其轉換為共有財產權。
NOTICE UNDER S.24C(1) OF THE BUILDINGS O:
Notice under Section 24C(1) of the Buildings Ordinance is a legal document used in relation to building structures registered under the land registry.
It is submitted to notify the land registry of any changes or alterations made to the building structure.
The notice provides details of the specific modifications or additions made to the building.
It includes information such as the address of the property, the nature of the alterations, and the date of the notice.
The purpose of this notice is to ensure compliance with the regulations and requirements set forth by the Buildings Ordinance.
It serves as a formal notification to the land registry and other relevant parties of the changes made to the building structure.
The notice under Section 24C(1) helps maintain accurate and up-to-date records of building modifications and ensures legal compliance with building regulations.

《建築物條例》第24C(1)條通知是在土地註冊處登記的建築物上使用的法律文件。
它被提交以通知土地註冊處對建築物進行的任何改變或修改。
通知中提供了建築物所做的具體修改或增加的細節。
包括物業地址、改變的性質和通知的日期等信息。
這項通知的目的是確保遵守《建築物條例》設定的法規和要求。
它作為正式通知土地註冊處和其他相關方對建築物結構的變更。
《建築物條例》第24C(1)條通知有助於保持建築物修改的準確和最新記錄，確保符合建築物法規的法律要求。
This type of document is a formal notice issued under Section 24C(1) of the Buildings Ordinance, indicating certain actions or conditions related to the property.
這種文件是根據《建築物條例》第24C(1)條發出的正式通知，指明與該物業相關的某些行動或狀況。
NOTICE UNDER S.30B(3) OF THE BUILDINGS O:
A notice under Section 30B(3) of the Buildings Ordinance is a legal document used in the land registry for buildings.
It is submitted to notify the land registry of the existence of unauthorized building works or alterations.
The notice provides details of the specific unauthorized works or alterations carried out in the building.
It includes information such as the address of the property, the nature of the unauthorized works, and the date of the notice.
The purpose of this notice is to inform the land registry and other relevant parties about the unauthorized works or alterations in the building.
It serves as an official notification of the non-compliance with the regulations and requirements set forth in the Buildings Ordinance.
The notice under Section 30B(3) of the Buildings Ordinance helps to maintain accurate and up-to-date records of unauthorized building works and ensures compliance with the legal requirements of the Buildings Ordinance.

根據《建築物條例》第30B(3)條的通知是土地註冊處用於建築物的法律文件。
它用於通知土地註冊處存在未經授權的建築工程或改建工程。
通知提供了建築物中具體未經授權的工程或改建工程的詳細信息。
包括物業地址、未經授權工程的性質以及通知的日期等信息。
這份通知的目的是通知土地註冊處和其他相關方，建築物中存在未經授權的工程或改建工程。
它作為一份官方通知，宣告未遵守《建築物條例》的法規和要求。
《建築物條例》第30B(3)條的通知有助於保持未經授權建築工程的準確和最新記錄，確保符合法規要求。
This type of document is an official notice issued under Section 30B(3) of the Buildings Ordinance, indicating certain actions or conditions related to the property.
這種文件是根據《建築物條例》第30B(3)條發出的官方通知，指明與該物業相關的某些行動或條件。
NOTICE UNDER S.30C(3) OF THE BUILDINGS O:
A notice under Section 30C(3) of the Buildings Ordinance is a legal document used by the Land Registry for buildings.
It is used to notify the Land Registry of unauthorized works or alterations in a building.
The notice provides detailed information about the specific unauthorized works or alterations within the building.
This includes the property address, nature of the unauthorized works, and the date of the notice.
The purpose of this notice is to inform the Land Registry and other relevant parties about the presence of unauthorized works or alterations in the building.
It serves as an official notification declaring non-compliance with the regulations and requirements of the Buildings Ordinance.
The notice under Section 30C(3) of the Buildings Ordinance helps maintain accurate and up-to-date records of unauthorized building works, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.

它用於通知土地註冊處有關建築物內的未經授權工程或改建。
該通知提供了有關建築物內具體未經授權工程或改建的詳細信息。
包括物業地址、未經授權工程的性質和通知日期等。
這項通知的目的是通知土地註冊處和其他相關方，建築物內存在未經授權的工程或改建。
