NOTIFICATION LETTER OF COMPLETION OF WOR:
A notification letter of completion of works is a document issued by the Land Registry.
It serves as a notification to inform the Land Registry that construction or renovation works have been completed on a property.
The letter contains essential information such as the property address, nature of the completed works, and the date of completion.
It is a formal acknowledgement that the construction or renovation works have been finished according to the approved plans and specifications.
The notification letter of completion of works helps to update the Land Registry's records and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
It provides a record of the completed works, which may be relevant for future property transactions or legal purposes.
The letter signifies the fulfillment of the construction or renovation process and marks an important milestone for the property owner.

完工通知函是由土地註冊處發出的文件。
它用於通知土地註冊處某個物業的建築或裝修工程已經完成。
該函件包含重要的信息，例如物業地址、完成的工程性質和完成日期。
它是一份正式的確認，表明建築或裝修工程已按照批准的計劃和規格完成。
完工通知函有助於更新土地註冊處的記錄，確保符合法規要求。
它提供了已完成工程的記錄，對於日後的物業交易或法律目的可能具有相關性。
該函件表示建築或裝修過程已經完成，對於物業業主來說標誌著一個重要的里程碑。
This type of document is a letter that officially notifies the completion of construction or renovation works on the property.
這種文件是一封正式通知工程或翻新工程完成的信函。

The Notification Letter of Completion of Works Relating to Order is a document issued by the Land Registry.
It is used to notify the Land Registry that certain works related to an order or requirement have been completed.
The letter contains essential information, such as the property address, nature of the completed works, and the date of completion.
It serves as an official confirmation that the specified works have been carried out in accordance with the order or requirement.
The Notification Letter helps in updating the Land Registry records and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.
It provides a record of the completed works, which may be relevant for future property transactions or legal purposes.
The letter signifies the completion of the specified works, marking an important milestone for the property owner.

「完工通知書（與命令相關的工程）」是由地政總署發出的文件。
它用於通知地政總署某項與命令或要求相關的工程已經完成。
通知書包含基本信息，如物業地址、完成工程的性質和完成日期。
它作為官方確認指定工程按照命令或要求進行完成的文件。
通知書有助於更新地政總署的記錄，確保遵守監管要求。
它提供了已完成工程的記錄，可能與未來的物業交易或法律目的相關。
通知書標誌著指定工程的完成，對於物業業主來說是一個重要的里程碑。
This type of document is a notification letter that confirms the completion of works related to an order issued by the relevant authority.
這類文件是一封通知信，確認了與相關當局所發布的命令有關的工程已經完成。
OCCUPATION PERMIT:
An Occupation Permit is a document issued by the relevant authority that allows the occupant to legally use and occupy a specific property or premises.
It signifies that the construction or renovation works on the property have been completed and comply with the applicable building regulations and standards.
The permit is granted after a thorough inspection and verification of the property's compliance with safety, health, and environmental requirements.
It grants the occupant the right to move into and utilize the property for the intended purpose, such as residential or commercial use.
The Occupation Permit is an important legal document that ensures the property is fit for occupancy and meets the necessary regulatory standards.
It may be required for various purposes, including obtaining utilities connections, conducting business activities, or applying for financing or insurance.
The permit serves as proof that the property has been assessed and deemed suitable for occupation according to the established regulations and guidelines.

居住證明書是由相關機構發出的文件，允許居住者合法使用和佔用特定的物業或場所。
它表示該物業的建築或翻新工程已經完成，並符合適用的建築法規和標準。
在對物業進行安全、衛生和環境要求的全面檢查和驗證後，發放居住證明書。
它授予居住者合法進入並使用該物業的權利，例如居住或商業用途。
居住證明書是一份重要的法律文件，確保物業符合居住要求並符合相關的監管標準。
它可能需要用於不同的目的，包括獲取公用事業連接、開展業務活動或申請融資或保險等。
該證明書作為該物業已根據建立的法規和指南進行評估並被認為適合居住的證據。
This type of document is a permit issued by the relevant authority that grants the legal right to occupy a property upon completion of construction and compliance with building regulations.
這種文件是由相關機構發出的許可證，表示在建築工程完成並符合建築法規的條件下，合法地佔用該物業的權利。
ORDER:
An order is a legal directive issued by a competent authority or court.
It may pertain to various matters related to land or property, such as development, use, or restrictions.
Orders are issued to regulate, control, or rectify specific situations or activities concerning land.
They can be enforced to ensure compliance with statutory requirements, planning regulations, or building codes.
Orders may impose restrictions, specify conditions, or mandate specific actions to be taken by the parties involved.
They can be issued to address issues related to safety, public health, environmental concerns, or land use conflicts.
Orders may be subject to appeal or review processes, allowing affected parties to challenge or seek modifications to the directives.

命令是由有管轄權的機構或法院發出的法律指令。
它可能涉及土地或財產的各種事項，如開發、使用或限制。
命令是為了規範、控制或糾正與土地有關的特定情況或活動而發出的。
它們可以被執行，以確保遵守法定要求、規劃法規或建築代碼。
命令可能會對當事人施加限制，指定條件，或要求採取具體行動。
它們可以用於解決與安全、公共衛生、環境問題或土地使用衝突有關的問題。
命令可能會受到上訴或審查程序的約束，使受影響的當事人有權對指令進行挑戰或尋求修改。
This type of document refers to a legal directive or command issued by an authority, which may contain instructions, restrictions, or requirements related to the property or its use.
這種文件指的是由權威機構發出的法律指令或命令，可能包含與該物業或其使用有關的指示、限制或要求。
ORDER UNDER S.24(1) OF THE BUILDINGS ORD:
An Order under Section 24(1) of the Buildings Ordinance is a legal directive issued by the relevant authority or court.
It is related to matters concerning buildings and construction activities.
The Order is issued to address and regulate specific issues or violations related to building safety, construction standards, or unauthorized works.
It may require the responsible party to rectify the non-compliant conditions, carry out necessary repairs, or take corrective actions.
The Order may include directives to cease certain activities, make structural alterations, or implement safety measures.
Failure to comply with the Order may result in penalties, legal consequences, or further enforcement actions.
The affected parties have the right to appeal or seek redress through the prescribed legal procedures.

受影響的各方有權通過指定的法律程序提出上訴或尋求救濟。
