該命令可能要求負責人改正不符合規定的情況，進行必要的維修或採取補救措施。
它可能包括停止某些活動、進行結構改建或實施安全措施的指示。
不遵守該命令可能導致罰款、法律後果或進一步的執法行動。
相關當事人有權通過指定的法律程序提出上訴或尋求救濟。

This type of document refers to a formal order issued under Section 27A of the Buildings Ordinance, containing instructions, requirements, or restrictions related to the property or its use, along with an attached plan.
這種文件是指根據《建築物條例》第27A條發出的正式命令，其中包含與該物業或其使用相關的指示、要求或限制，並附有一份附帶的平面圖。
ORDER UNDER S.28(3) OF THE BUILDINGS ORD:
An Order under Section 28(3) of the Buildings Ordinance is a legal directive issued by the relevant authority or court.
This Order is related to the construction or alteration of a building and aims to address specific issues or concerns.
It may require the responsible party to comply with certain requirements, such as rectifying non-compliant conditions or making necessary modifications.
The Order may specify actions such as halting construction activities, carrying out necessary repairs, or implementing safety measures.
Non-compliance with the Order may result in penalties, legal consequences, or further enforcement actions.
Parties involved have the right to appeal or seek remedies through designated legal procedures.
The Order under Section 28(3) of the Buildings Ordinance is intended to ensure compliance with building regulations and promote safety in construction projects.

根據《建築物條例》第28(3)條，「第28(3)條之命令」是由相關機構或法院發布的法定指令。
此命令與建築物的建造或改建有關，旨在解決特定的問題或關注點。
它可能要求負責人遵守某些要求，例如修正不符合規定的情況或進行必要的修改。
該命令可能會規定採取行動，如停止施工活動、進行必要的維修或實施安全措施。
不遵守該命令可能會導致處罰、法律後果或進一步的執行行動。
相關當事人有權通過指定的法律程序提出上訴或尋求救濟。
《建築物條例》第28(3)條之命令旨在確保遵守建築法規並促進建築項目的安全性。
This type of document refers to a formal order issued under Section 28(3) of the Buildings Ordinance, containing instructions, requirements, or restrictions related to the property or its use.
這種文件指的是根據《建築物條例》第28(3)條發出的正式命令，其中包含與該物業或其使用相關的指示、要求或限制。

Issued under Section 28(3) of the Buildings Ordinance, an order with plan is a legal directive related to construction or alteration of a building.
This order is issued by relevant authorities or the court to address specific issues or concerns.
It may require the responsible party to comply with certain requirements, such as rectifying non-compliant conditions or making necessary modifications.
The order may prescribe actions to be taken, such as halting construction activities, carrying out essential repairs, or implementing safety measures.
Non-compliance with the order can result in penalties, legal consequences, or further enforcement actions.
Parties involved have the right to appeal or seek remedies through specified legal procedures.
The order under Section 28(3) of the Buildings Ordinance aims to ensure compliance with building regulations and promote the safety of the construction project.

根據《建築物條例》第28(3)條，帶有計劃的命令是與建築物的建造或改建相關的法定指令。
這項命令是由相關機構或法院發出，以解決特定問題或關切。
它可能要求負責方遵守一定的要求，例如糾正不符合條件或進行必要的修改。
命令可能規定採取行動，例如停止施工活動、進行必要的維修或實施安全措施。
不遵守該命令可能導致處罰、法律後果或進一步的執法行動。
相關方有權通過指定的法律程序提出上訴或尋求救濟。
《建築物條例》第28(3)條的命令旨在確保建築物規範的遵守，並促進建築項目的安全性。

This type of document refers to an official order issued under Section 28(3) of the Buildings Ordinance, which includes instructions, requirements, or restrictions related to the property or its use, along with a plan.
這類文件是指根據《建築物條例》第28(3)條所發出的正式指令，其中包含與該物業或其使用有關的指示、要求或限制，並附有一份平面圖。
PARTIAL RELEASE:
A partial release refers to the release of a specific portion or part of a property from a previously registered charge or mortgage.
It allows the owner to free a portion of their property from the encumbrance of the charge or mortgage.
The partial release is typically granted when the owner has paid off a portion of the debt secured by the charge or mortgage.
It is a legal document that is executed and registered with the land registry to officially remove the charge or mortgage from the specified portion of the property.
The release may be subject to certain conditions or restrictions specified in the partial release document.
The remaining portion of the property that is not included in the partial release will continue to be encumbered by the charge or mortgage.
The partial release provides the property owner with more flexibility and the ability to deal with the released portion separately from the encumbered portion.

部分釋放指的是從先前註冊的負擔或按揭中釋放特定部分或一部分財產。
它允許所有者將其財產的某一部分從負擔或按揭的限制中解脫出來。
部分釋放通常在所有者還清了負擔或按揭所擔保的部分債務時進行。
它是一份法律文件，通過在土地註冊處登記，正式將負擔或按揭從指定的財產部分中移除。
部分釋放可能受到部分釋放文件中指定的某些條件或限制的限制。
沒有被部分釋放的財產部分將繼續受到負擔或按揭的約束。
部分釋放為財產所有者提供了更大的靈活性，使其能夠將釋放部分與未釋放部分分開處理。
This type of document refers to a registered release of a portion of a property from a mortgage or other encumbrances, allowing for the transfer or sale of that specific portion.
這種文件是指從抵押貸款或其他負擔中釋放出該財產部分的登記文件，允許該特定部分進行轉讓或出售。
POWER OF ATTORNEY:
A Power of Attorney is a legal document that authorizes one person (the attorney-in-fact) to act on behalf of another person (the principal) in specific matters related to land or property.
It grants the attorney-in-fact the authority to make decisions, sign documents, and perform actions on behalf of the principal regarding the property.
The Power of Attorney can be limited to specific tasks or broad enough to cover a range of actions.
It is often used when the principal is unable to personally handle property-related matters due to various reasons such as illness, absence, or convenience.
The Power of Attorney must be in writing, signed by the principal, and sometimes requires witnesses or notarization.
It is an important legal instrument that enables someone to manage and transact property-related affairs on behalf of the principal with the same authority as if they were the principal themselves.
The Power of Attorney can be revoked or terminated by the principal at any time.

委任書是一份法律文件，授權一人（代理人）代表另一人（委託人）處理與土地或財產有關的特定事務。
它賦予代理人權力，代表委託人在財產事務方面做出決定、簽署文件和執行行動。
委任書可以限定特定任務，也可以涵蓋廣泛的行動範圍。
當委託人因疾病、離境或方便等原因無法親自處理財產事務時，通常會使用委任書。
委任書必須以書面形式，由委託人簽署，有時需要見證人或公證。
它是一個重要的法律工具，使某人能夠代表委託人管理和處理與財產有關的事務，具有與委託人本人相同的權限。
委任書可以隨時由委託人撤銷或終止。
This type of document grants someone the legal authority to act on behalf of another person in making decisions or managing affairs related to the property.
這種文件授予某人在處理與該物業相關的決策或管理事務時代表他人行事的合法權力。
PRELIMINARY AGREEMENT FOR SALE AND PURCH:
A preliminary agreement for sale and purchase is a legally binding contract between a buyer and a seller in a property transaction.
It outlines the terms and conditions of the intended sale and purchase of the property.
The agreement typically includes details such as the purchase price, payment terms, property description, and any special conditions or contingencies.
It serves as a preliminary step before the formal completion of the sale and purchase agreement.
The preliminary agreement allows both parties to negotiate and agree on the essential terms before proceeding with the transaction.
It provides a level of security and commitment from both the buyer and the seller.
In case of any breach or non-compliance, the parties may seek legal remedies as stipulated in the agreement.
The preliminary agreement for sale and purchase is an important document in property transactions, ensuring clarity and mutual understanding between the parties involved.

預售協議是買賣雙方在房地產交易中簽訂的具有法律約束力的合同。
該協議詳細列明了預定的買賣條款和條件。
協議通常包括購買價格、付款條款、物業描述以及任何特殊條件或附帶條件。
它作為正式的買賣合同簽訂之前的初步步驟。
預售協議允許雙方在交易進行之前就重要條款進行協商和達成共識。
它提供了買方和賣方之間的一定程度的安全和承諾。
在違約或不履行的情況下，雙方可以根據協議中的規定尋求法律救濟。
預售協議是房地產交易中的重要文件，確保雙方之間的清晰和互相理解。
This type of document is a preliminary agreement between the buyer and seller outlining the terms and conditions for the future sale and purchase of the property.
這種文件是買方和賣方之間的初步協議，概述了未來買賣該物業的條款和條件。
PRELIMINARY SALE AND PURCHASE AGREEMENT:
A preliminary sale and purchase agreement is a legally binding contract signed by both parties in a real estate transaction.
It outlines the agreed-upon terms and conditions of the intended sale and purchase.
The agreement typically includes the purchase price, payment terms, property description, and any special or ancillary conditions.
It serves as a preliminary step before the formal sale and purchase agreement is executed.
The preliminary agreement allows for negotiation and consensus on important terms before the transaction takes place.
It provides a certain level of security and commitment between the buyer and seller.
In case of default or non-performance, both parties can seek legal remedies as stipulated in the agreement.
The preliminary sale and purchase agreement is an important document in real estate transactions, ensuring clarity and mutual understanding between the parties involved.

初步買賣合約是由房地產交易雙方簽署的具有法律約束力的合約。
它概述了預定買賣的條款和條件。
該合約通常包括購買價格、付款方式、物業描述和任何特殊或附加條件。
它是在正式買賣合約簽訂之前的初步步驟。
初步合約允許在交易發生之前就重要條款進行談判和達成共識。
它提供了買方和賣方之間的一定程度的安全和承諾。
在違約或不履行的情況下，雙方可以根據合約中規定的條款尋求法律救濟。
初步買賣合約是房地產交易中的重要文件，確保交易雙方之間的清晰和相互理解。
This type of document is an initial agreement between the buyer and seller that outlines the terms and conditions for the future sale and purchase of the property.
這種文件是買方和賣方之間的初步協議，概述了未來買賣房產的條款和條件。
PROBATE:
Probate is a legal process that validates and administers the estate of a deceased person.
It involves proving the authenticity of the deceased person's will and granting authority to the executor named in the will.
The purpose of probate is to ensure the proper distribution of the deceased person's assets according to their wishes or applicable laws.
The process typically includes filing the will with the appropriate court, notifying beneficiaries and creditors, gathering and appraising the estate's assets, paying outstanding debts and taxes, and distributing the remaining assets to the beneficiaries.
Probate provides a legal framework for resolving any disputes or claims related to the estate.
It also offers protection to the executor by granting them the legal authority to manage and distribute the estate's assets.
The land registry may require proof of probate before transferring the deceased person's property to their beneficiaries.

遺囑認證是一個法律程序，用於驗證和管理已故人士的遺產。
它涉及證實已故人士的遺囑的真實性，並授予遺囑中指定的執行人權限。
遺囑認證的目的是確保根據已故人士的意願或適用法律正確分配遺產。
該過程通常包括將遺囑提交給適當的法院，通知受益人和債權人，收集和評估遺產的資產，支付未償債務和稅款，並將剩餘資產分配給受益人。
遺囑認證提供了一個法律框架，用於解決與遺產相關的任何爭議或索賠。
它還通過授予執行人合法權限來保護執行人管理和分配遺產資產。
土地登記可能要求提供遺囑認證的證明，才能將已故人士的財產轉讓給他們的受益人。
This type of document is a legal confirmation of the validity of a deceased person's will and the appointment of an executor to handle the estate.
這類文件是對逝者遺囑的合法確認，並指派執行者處理遺產事務。
PROVISIONAL AGREEMENT FOR SALE AND PURCH:
A provisional agreement for sale and purchase is a legally binding contract between a buyer and a seller for the purchase of a property.
It outlines the terms and conditions of the sale, including the agreed-upon purchase price, payment terms, and other relevant provisions.
The provisional agreement serves as an initial commitment between the parties before the execution of the formal sale and purchase agreement.
It provides a framework for the transfer of ownership rights and responsibilities from the seller to the buyer.
The provisional agreement typically includes provisions related to property inspections, financing arrangements, and timelines for completing the transaction.
It may also address contingencies such as obtaining necessary approvals or permits before the sale is finalized.
The provisional agreement for sale and purchase helps establish the intentions and obligations of both parties and serves as a legal basis for the subsequent transfer of the property.

一份臨時買賣協議是買方與賣方之間的具有法律約束力的合同，用於買賣房產。
該協議概述了買賣條件，包括約定的購買價格、付款條款和其他相關條款。
臨時協議在正式的買賣協議簽署之前，為雙方提供了一個初步承諾的框架。
它確立了所有權的轉移以及賣方向買方轉移責任的基礎。
臨時協議通常包括與房產檢查、融資安排和交易完成時間表等相關條款。
它還可能涉及在交易最終完成之前取得必要批准或許可證的條件。
臨時買賣協議有助於確定雙方的意圖和義務，並作為財產轉移的法律依據。
This type of document is a preliminary agreement between the buyer and seller of a property, outlining the terms and conditions of the future sale and purchase transaction.
這種文件是買賣雙方對未來的房地產交易的初步協議，概述了交易的條款和條件。
RECEIPT ON DISCHARGE:
A receipt on discharge is a document issued by the land registry to acknowledge the settlement of a charge or mortgage on a property.
It serves as proof that the debt or obligation secured by the charge has been fully paid or otherwise discharged.
The receipt on discharge typically contains details of the property, the charge or mortgage being discharged, and the date of the discharge.
It may also include information about the party who paid off the debt or the method of discharge, such as a release of the charge or a satisfaction of the mortgage.
The receipt on discharge is an important document that confirms the removal of the charge or mortgage from the property's title records.
It provides assurance to the property owner and any future buyers or lenders that the property is no longer encumbered by the discharged charge or mortgage.
The receipt on discharge is often required during property transactions and refinancing processes to demonstrate the clear title of the property.

"Receipt on discharge" 是由土地註冊處發出的文件，用於確認一項負擔或按揭已經完全清償或解除。
它作為證明有關負擔或按揭已經完全支付或解除的憑證。
"Receipt on discharge" 通常包含有關物業、被解除的負擔或按揭的詳細信息以及解除日期。
它可能還包括支付債務的一方或解除方式的信息，例如解除負擔或按揭的確認或滿足。
"Receipt on discharge" 是一份重要文件，確認該負擔或按揭已從物業的產權記錄中移除。
它向物業業主和未來的買家或貸款人提供保證，確保該物業不再受到解除的負擔或按揭的限制。
"Receipt on discharge" 在物業交易和再融資過程中通常需要，以展示物業的清晰產權。
This type of document is a receipt issued upon the discharge or release of a mortgage or legal charge on a property.
這類文件是在解除或釋放買賣物業的抵押貸款或法律負擔時發行的收據。
RECEIPT ON DISCHARGE OF A CHARGE:
"Receipt on discharge of a charge" is a document issued by the Land Registry to confirm the complete payment or discharge of a registered charge on a property.
It serves as proof that the charge has been fully satisfied and released.
The receipt typically contains details of the property, the discharged charge, and the date of discharge.
It may also include information about the party making the payment or the method of discharge, such as confirmation or satisfaction of the charge.
The "Receipt on discharge of a charge" is an important document that verifies the removal of the charge from the property's title records.
It provides assurance to the property owner and future buyers or lenders that the property is no longer encumbered by the discharged charge.
The "Receipt on discharge of a charge" is often required in property transactions and refinancing processes to demonstrate clear ownership of the property.

「收到抵押貸款解除的收據」是由土地註冊處發出的文件，確認對房產的註冊抵押貸款已完全支付或解除。
它作為證明抵押貸款已經完全滿足並解除的證據。
收據通常包含有關房產、解除的抵押貸款以及解除日期的詳細信息。
它還可能包括付款方或解除方式（例如確認或滿足抵押貸款）的相關信息。
「收到抵押貸款解除的收據」是一份重要文件，可以證明該貸款已從房產的產權記錄中移除。
它向房產所有者和未來的買家或貸款人提供保證，證明該房產不再受到抵押貸款的限制。
「收到抵押貸款解除的收據」通常在房產交易和再融資過程中需要，以證明該房產的清晰所有權。
This type of document is a receipt issued when a charge on a property, such as a mortgage or legal encumbrance, is discharged or released.
這類文件是在對一筆負擔（如抵押貸款或法律負擔）進行解除或釋放時所發出的收據。
RELEASE:
A release is a legal document issued by the land registry that signifies the removal or discharge of a registered encumbrance or restriction on a property.
It serves as evidence that a particular encumbrance or restriction has been released and is no longer in effect.
A release typically includes details such as the property's description, the specific encumbrance or restriction being released, and the date of release.
It may also provide information about the party requesting the release and any conditions or considerations associated with the release.
A release is an important document that confirms the freedom and clear title of a property from any previously registered encumbrances or restrictions.
It is often required during property transactions or refinancing processes to demonstrate the removal of any encumbrances that may affect the property's ownership or value.
The release document provides assurance to property owners, buyers, and lenders that the property is free from the encumbrance or restriction specified in the document.

一份解除文件是由地政署發出的法律文件，表示對於一個財產上的已登記限制或負擔的解除或解脫。
它作為證明特定限制或負擔已經解除並不再有效的證據。
解除文件通常包括財產的描述、被解除的具體限制或負擔，以及解除的日期。
它還可能提供有關申請解除的一方的信息，以及與解除相關的任何條件或考慮事項。
解除是一個重要文件，確認了財產從以前登記的限制或負擔中解脫並具有清晰標題。
在財產交易或再融資過程中，通常需要提供解除文件，以證明解除了可能影響財產所有權或價值的任何限制。
解除文件為財產所有者、買家和貸方提供保證，證明該財產已經從文件中指定的限制或負擔中解除。
This type of document is issued when a legal claim or encumbrance on a property is released or discharged, indicating that the property is no longer subject to that claim or encumbrance.
這類文件是在法律索賠或負擔釋放時發出的，表示該物業不再受到該索賠或負擔的限制，已被釋放。
RENT ASSIGNMENT:
Rent assignment is a legal document that transfers the rights and obligations of a lease agreement from the original tenant (assignor) to a new tenant (assignee).
It is a formal agreement that allows the assignee to take over the lease and assume all the responsibilities of the original tenant.
The rent assignment document typically includes details such as the names of the parties involved, the property address, the terms of the original lease, and the assignment terms.
It serves as evidence of the transfer of lease rights and is often recorded at the land registry for public record.
Rent assignment is commonly used in commercial real estate transactions, allowing tenants to transfer their lease obligations to another party.
The assignee becomes responsible for paying the rent and complying with all the terms and conditions of the original lease.
Rent assignment provides a legal framework for the transfer of lease rights and ensures continuity in the occupancy of the property.

租金轉讓是一份法律文件，將租賃協議的權利和義務從原租戶（轉讓人）轉讓給新租戶（受讓人）。
這是一份正式協議，允許受讓人接管租約並承擔原租戶的所有責任。
租金轉讓文件通常包括參與方的姓名、物業地址、原租約條款和轉讓條款等詳細信息。
它作為租約權益轉移的證據，通常在土地註冊處登記，供公眾查閱。
租金轉讓在商業房地產交易中常被使用，允許租戶將租賃義務轉讓給另一方。
受讓人將負責支付租金並遵守原租約的所有條款和條件。
租金轉讓為租約權益轉移提供了法律框架，確保了物業的持續佔用。
This type of document refers to the transfer of a leaseholder's right to receive rental income from the property to another party.
這種文件是指將租賃人的租金收入權利轉讓給另一方的文件。
RENTAL ASSIGNMENT:
Rental assignment is a legal document that transfers the rights and obligations of a lease agreement from the original tenant (assignor) to a new tenant (assignee).
It is a formal agreement that allows the assignee to take over the lease and assume all the responsibilities of the original tenant.
The rental assignment document typically includes detailed information such as the names of the parties involved, property address, terms of the original lease, and assignment terms.
It serves as evidence of the transfer of lease rights and is often registered at the land registry for public access.
Rental assignments are commonly used in commercial real estate transactions, allowing tenants to transfer their lease obligations to another party.
The assignee becomes responsible for paying rent and complying with all the terms and conditions of the original lease.
Rental assignment provides a legal framework for the transfer of lease rights, ensuring the continued occupancy of the property.

租金轉讓是一份法律文件，將租賃協議的權利和義務從原租戶（轉讓人）轉讓給新租戶（受讓人）。
這是一份正式協議，允許受讓人接管租賃合約並承擔原租戶的所有責任。
租金轉讓文件通常包含詳細信息，例如當事人姓名、物業地址、原租約條款和轉讓條款。
它作為轉讓租賃權利的證明，通常在土地註冊處登記以供公眾查閱。
租金轉讓在商業房地產交易中常見，允許租戶將其租賃義務轉讓給其他方。
受讓人將負責支付租金並遵守原租約的所有條款和條件。
租金轉讓提供了轉讓租賃權利的法律框架，確保物業的持續租賃。
This type of document refers to the transfer of rental rights from one party to another, typically involving the assignment of a lease agreement for a property.
此類文件是指將租金權利從一方轉讓給另一方，通常涉及將房屋租賃合同轉讓的行為。
REREGISTRATION OF AGREEMENT FOR SALE AND:
Reregistration of Agreement for Sale and Purchase Memorial is a process that involves updating or re-registering an existing memorial document related to a sale and purchase agreement.
It is a legal procedure carried out at the land registry to ensure the accuracy and validity of the agreement.
The purpose of reregistering the memorial is to reflect any changes or updates made to the original agreement, such as amendments, extensions, or modifications.
The reregistration process involves submitting the updated memorial document to the land registry for official record-keeping.
It helps maintain a complete and up-to-date record of the agreement for sale and purchase, providing a clear and transparent history of the transaction.
Reregistration ensures that all parties involved in the agreement are aware of any changes and that the land registry has the most accurate information regarding the property transaction.
The reregistration process provides legal protection and helps avoid any disputes or confusion regarding the terms and conditions of the sale and purchase agreement.

重新登記買賣合約備忘錄是一個過程，涉及更新或重新登記與買賣合約相關的現有備忘錄文件。
這是在土地註冊處進行的法律程序，旨在確保合約的準確性和有效性。
重新登記備忘錄的目的是反映對原始合約進行的任何更改或更新，如修訂、延長或修改等。
重新登記的過程涉及將更新的備忘錄文件提交給土地註冊處進行正式的記錄保存。
它有助於維護完整且最新的買賣合約記錄，提供交易的清晰透明的歷史記錄。
重新登記確保所有涉及合約的各方都知道任何更改，並且土地註冊處擁有關於財產交易的最準確信息。
重新登記程序提供法律保護，有助於避免任何關於買賣合約條款和條件的爭議或混淆。
This type of document refers to the registration of an agreement for sale and purchase with the land registry, indicating the existence of a contractual arrangement regarding the property.
這類文件是指將買賣協議重新登記在土地註冊處，表明關於該物業存在一份合同安排。
REREGISTRATION OF ASSIGNMENT MEMORIAL:
Reregistration of Assignment Memorial is a process that involves updating or re-registering existing memorial documents related to an assignment.
It is a legal procedure carried out at the Land Registry to ensure the accuracy and validity of the assignment.
The purpose of reregistering the memorial is to reflect any changes or updates made to the original assignment, such as amendments, extensions, or modifications.
The process of reregistration involves submitting the updated memorial documents to the Land Registry for formal record-keeping.
It helps maintain a complete and up-to-date record of the assignment, providing a clear and transparent history of the transaction.
Reregistration ensures that all parties involved in the assignment are aware of any changes, and the Land Registry possesses the most accurate information about the property transaction.
The reregistration process provides legal protection and helps avoid any disputes or confusion regarding the terms and conditions of the assignment.

重新登記轉讓紀錄是一個程序，涉及更新或重新登記與轉讓相關的現有紀錄文件。
這是在土地註冊處進行的法律程序，以確保轉讓的準確性和有效性。
重新登記紀錄的目的是反映對原始轉讓文件所做的任何更改或更新，如修訂、延長或修改等。
重新登記的過程涉及將更新的紀錄文件提交給土地註冊處進行正式的記錄保存。
它有助於維護有關轉讓的完整且最新的記錄，提供清晰和透明的交易歷史。
重新登記確保所有涉及轉讓的各方都知道任何變更，並使土地註冊處擁有關於財產交易的最準確信息。
重新登記程序提供法律保護，有助於避免關於轉讓條款和條件的任何爭議或混淆。
This type of document refers to the re-registration of an assignment agreement at the land registry, indicating the transfer of ownership or rights from one party to another.
這種文件指的是在土地註冊處重新註冊轉讓協議，表示所有權或權利從一方轉移到另一方。
REVERSE MORTGAGE:
A reverse mortgage is a financial arrangement that allows homeowners to access the equity in their property while retaining ownership and the right to live in the home.
It is a type of loan where the lender provides regular payments or a lump sum to the homeowner, based on the appraised value of the property and the homeowner's age.
The loan does not require immediate repayment and typically becomes due when the homeowner moves out, sells the property, or passes away.
The reverse mortgage is registered under the land registry to establish the lender's lien or charge against the property.
The registration provides notice to other parties that there is a mortgage on the property and helps protect the lender's interest in case of default.
The reverse mortgage can be a useful financial tool for retirees or older individuals who want to access the equity in their property without having to sell it or make regular loan payments.

反向抵押貸款是一種金融安排，允許房屋所有者在保留所有權和居住權的情況下，取得其房產中的權益。
這是一種貸款形式，貸方根據房產的估值和借款人的年齡，提供定期支付或一筆款項給房屋所有者。
該貸款不需要立即償還，通常在借款人搬離、出售房產或去世時到期。
反向抵押貸款在土地註冊處登記，以建立貸方對房產的抵押權或負擔。
註冊提供對其他各方的通知，表明該房產上存在抵押貸款，並有助於在違約情況下保護貸方的利益。
反向抵押貸款對於退休人士或年長個人而言，是一種有用的金融工具，可以在不必出售房產或定期償還貸款的情況下，獲取房產中的權益。
This type of document refers to a mortgage arrangement where the homeowner receives periodic payments from the lender, using their home as collateral.
這種文件指的是一種抵押安排，房主以其房屋作為擔保，從貸款人處定期獲得支付。
SALE AND PURCHASE AGREEMENT:
A Sale and Purchase Agreement is a legally binding contract between a buyer and a seller for the purchase of a property.
It outlines the terms and conditions of the sale, including the purchase price, payment terms, and property details.
The agreement serves as evidence of the buyer's intention to purchase and the seller's intention to sell the property.
It may include clauses related to contingencies, such as property inspections, financing, or legal requirements.
The agreement is typically prepared by the seller's solicitor or conveyancer and signed by both parties.
It plays a crucial role in property transactions as it provides clarity and protection for both the buyer and the seller, ensuring a smooth and transparent transfer of property ownership.

銷售和購買協議是買方和賣方之間關於購買房產的具有法律約束力的合同。
它詳細說明了銷售的條款和條件，包括購買價格、付款方式和房產細節。
這份協議作為買方打算購買和賣方打算出售房產的證據。
它可能包含與房產檢查、融資或法律要求等相關的條款。
通常由賣方的律師或產權轉讓人準備並由雙方簽署。
在房產交易中起著重要作用，為買方和賣方提供明確性和保護，確保房產所有權的順利和透明轉移。
This type of document refers to a legal agreement between a buyer and a seller outlining the terms and conditions for the sale and purchase of a property.
這種文件指的是買賣雙方之間就財產的購買和銷售條款和條件所簽署的法律協議。
SATISFACTION LETTER:
A satisfaction letter is a document that signifies the fulfillment or completion of certain obligations or conditions related to a property.
It is usually issued by the party responsible for the fulfillment, such as the mortgage lender or the party holding a charge on the property.
The satisfaction letter confirms that the requirements or conditions specified in a previous agreement or legal document have been met.
It serves as evidence that the obligations have been satisfied, such as the full repayment of a mortgage loan or the release of a charge on the property.
The satisfaction letter is an important document in property transactions, providing assurance to the involved parties and allowing for the smooth progress of the transaction.
It may be required to be submitted to the land registry or other relevant authorities as proof of compliance with certain requirements.

滿意書是一份文件，表示與房地產有關的某些義務或條件已完成或履行。
通常由負責履行的一方（如抵押貸款人或持有抵押權的一方）發出。
滿意書確認先前協議或法律文件中指定的要求或條件已經滿足。
它作為證明義務已經履行的證據，例如完全償還抵押貸款或解除對房產的抵押權。
滿意書是房地產交易中的重要文件，為相關方提供保證，促使交易順利進行。
需要將滿意書提交給土地註冊處或其他相關機構，以作為遵守某些要求的證明。
This type of document confirms the fulfillment of certain requirements or conditions, typically related to the discharge or satisfaction of a legal obligation or agreement.
這類文件確認某些要求或條件的達成，通常與履行法律義務或協議的解除或滿足有關。
SEALED COPY OF BANKRUPTCY ORDER ON DEBTO:
A sealed copy of a bankruptcy order on debtor's petition is a document issued by the court indicating that a debtor has been declared bankrupt.
It is a legal order that confirms the debtor's insolvency and initiates the bankruptcy process.
The sealed copy of the bankruptcy order contains important information, such as the name of the debtor, the date of the order, and the details of the bankruptcy proceedings.
It serves as evidence of the debtor's bankruptcy status and may be required for various legal and financial purposes.
The sealed copy of the bankruptcy order is typically filed with the land registry to ensure that the debtor's property rights and interests are appropriately addressed during the bankruptcy proceedings.
It is an essential document in the land registry records, providing transparency and clarity regarding the debtor's bankruptcy status and its impact on their property.

封存的債務人破產令副本是法院發出的文件，表明債務人已被宣告破產。
這是一項法律命令，確認債務人的無力償還債務，開始破產程序。
封存的破產令副本包含重要信息，如債務人的姓名、破產令日期以及破產程序的詳細信息。
它作為債務人破產狀態的證據，可能在各種法律和財務事務中需要使用。
債務人破產令副本通常在土地註冊處申報，以確保在破產程序中妥善處理債務人的財產權益。
作為土地註冊記錄中的重要文件，它提供了關於債務人破產狀態及其對財產的影響的透明度和清晰度。

This type of document is a sealed copy of the bankruptcy order issued by the court in response to the debtor's petition for bankruptcy. It signifies the official declaration of bankruptcy for the individual or entity.
這種文件是法院對債務人的破產申請所發出的破產令的封存副本。它表示對個人或實體的正式宣告破產。
SEALED COPY OF CHARGING ORDER ABSOLUTE:
A sealed copy of a Charging Order Absolute is a document issued by the court indicating the enforcement of a charging order against a debtor's property.
It is a legal order that secures the repayment of a debt by placing a charge on the debtor's property.
The sealed copy contains important information, such as the debtor's name, the date of the charging order, and details of the debt being secured.
It serves as evidence of the charging order and its impact on the debtor's property rights.
The sealed copy of the Charging Order Absolute is typically lodged with the land registry to ensure proper handling of the debtor's property in relation to the charging order.
As an important document in the land registry records, it provides transparency and clarity regarding the debtor's debt and the encumbrance on their property.

封存的「確定負擔令」的蓋印副本是法院發出的文件，表示對債務人的財產進行負擔令的執行。
該文件是一項法律命令，通過在債務人的財產上設置負擔來確保債務的償還。
封存的副本包含重要信息，如債務人的姓名、負擔令的日期和所確定的債務詳情。
它作為負擔令的證據，證明了對債務人財產權的影響。
負擔令的封存副本通常提交給土地註冊處，以確保妥善處理債務人的財產相關事宜。
作為土地註冊紀錄中的重要文件，它提供了有關債務人債務和對其財產的負擔的透明度和明確性。

This type of document is a sealed copy of a charging order absolute, which is a court order securing a debt against a property. It grants the creditor the right to enforce the charge and recover the debt.
這種文件是充權令書正本的封印副本，它是一份法院命令，將債務確定在一個財產上。它賦予債權人執行充權並追收債務的權利。
SEALED COPY OF CHARGING ORDER: NOTICE TO:
A sealed copy of Charging Order: Notice to Show Cause is a document issued by the court to notify the debtor of a charging order and require them to appear in court.
The notice serves as a legal notice to the debtor, informing them of the charging order placed on their property.
It outlines the reasons for the charging order and provides details of the court hearing where the debtor can present their case.
The sealed copy contains important information such as the debtor's name, the date of the notice, and the court hearing details.
It is typically filed with the land registry to ensure proper documentation and notification of the charging order.
This document is an important record in the land registry, providing transparency and clarity regarding the charging order and the debtor's obligations.

封存的抵押令副本：出示原因通知是由法院發出的文件，通知債務人有一項抵押令並要求其出庭。
該通知作為債務人的法定通知，告知其財產被抵押的事實。
它概述了抵押令的原因並提供了債務人在法庭上申辯的機會。
封存的副本包含重要信息，如債務人的姓名、通知日期和法庭聽證會的詳細信息。
通常會將此封存副本提交給土地註冊處，以確保抵押令的適當文件記錄和通知。
此文件是土地註冊處的重要記錄，提供了有關抵押令和債務人責任的透明度和清晰度。
This type of document is a sealed copy of a charging order that serves as a notice to the debtor, requiring them to demonstrate why the order should not be made final.
這種文件是一份封存的質權令副本，作為通知債務人的文件，要求他們證明為什麼不應該將該令變為最終確定。
SEALED COPY OF ORDER:
A sealed copy of an order refers to a document issued by a court that has been officially stamped or sealed.
It signifies that the order has been finalized and is legally binding.
The sealed copy contains the details and instructions of the court's decision or ruling.
It may include information such as the parties involved, the date of the order, and the specific actions required.
A sealed copy of an order filed with the land registry serves as an official record and notification of the court's decision regarding a property or land-related matter.
It ensures that the order is properly documented and can be referred to for legal purposes in relation to the property.

蓋有印章的命令副本指的是由法院正式蓋印或封存的文件。
它表示該命令已經確定並具有法律約束力。
蓋有印章的副本包含法院的決定或裁決的詳細信息和指示。
可能包括有關參與方、命令日期和具體要求的信息。
在土地註冊處提交的蓋有印章的命令副本是法院對財產或土地相關事項的決定的官方記錄和通知。
它確保該命令得到正確的記錄，並可用於與該財產有關的法律目的。
This type of document refers to a sealed copy of an official order that is registered in the land registry records. It typically contains legal instructions or rulings related to the property.
這種文件指的是在土地註冊記錄中註冊的一份封存的官方命令副本。通常包含與該物業有關的法律指示或裁決。
SEALED COPY OF WRIT OF SUMMONS:
A sealed copy of writ of summons refers to a document issued by the court and officially stamped or sealed.
It is a legal document that initiates a civil lawsuit and notifies the defendant of the legal action against them.
The sealed copy contains detailed information about the parties involved, the court case number, and the claims being made.
It outlines the allegations and demands of the plaintiff, including the relief sought and the deadline for responding.
A sealed copy of writ of summons filed with the land registry serves as an official record of the legal action affecting the property.
It ensures that the lawsuit is properly documented and can be used for legal purposes related to the property.

封存的傳票副本是由法院發出並正式蓋章的文件。
它是一份法律文件，用於啟動民事訴訟並通知被告知其所面臨的法律訴訟。
封存的副本包含有關涉及方、法庭案件編號和提出的訴訟主張的詳細信息。
它概述了原告的指控和要求，包括所尋求的救濟措施和回應的截止日期。
存檔於土地註冊處的封存傳票副本是關於該物業的法律訴訟的正式記錄。
它確保訴訟得到正確的記錄，並可用於與物業有關的法律目的。
This type of document refers to a sealed official copy of a writ of summons that has been registered in the land registry. It signifies the initiation of a legal action against the property owner.
這類文件指的是已在土地註冊處登記的一份密封官方副本，該副本為一份訴訟傳票，代表對房產所有人提起法律訴訟。
SECOND EQUITABLE MORTGAGE:
A second equitable mortgage is a type of mortgage that is registered against a property after an existing first mortgage.
It is a legal agreement where the property owner borrows money and offers the property as security for the loan.
The second equitable mortgage ranks lower in priority compared to the first mortgage, meaning that in the event of default and foreclosure, the proceeds from the sale of the property will first be used to satisfy the obligations of the first mortgage.
The second mortgage holder has a secondary claim on the property and may have a higher risk compared to the first mortgage holder.
The terms and conditions of the second equitable mortgage, such as interest rate, repayment schedule, and rights of the mortgage holder, are outlined in the mortgage agreement.
The registration of the second equitable mortgage at the land registry provides notice to potential buyers and other interested parties about the encumbrances on the property.

第二順位權益抵押是在現有第一順位抵押權後註冊於物業上的一種抵押權。
這是一份法律協議，物業所有人借錢並以該物業作為貸款的擔保品。
第二順位權益抵押在優先順序上低於第一順位抵押權，這意味著在違約和強制執行時，物業出售所獲得的款項將優先用於償還第一順位抵押權的債務。
第二順位抵押權持有人對該物業擁有次要的權益，可能面臨較高的風險。
第二順位權益抵押的條款和條件，如利率、還款計劃和抵押權持有人的權利，在抵押權協議中有所明確規定。
將第二順位權益抵押註冊於土地註冊處，通知潛在買家和其他利害關係人有關該物業的負擔事項。
This type of document refers to a registered mortgage that grants a secondary priority on the property, meaning it has a lower priority than the first mortgage in terms of repayment.
這種文件指的是在財產上登記的第二順位質押，意味著在還款方面它的優先順序低於第一順位質押。
SECOND LEGAL CHARGE:
A second legal charge is a type of mortgage that is registered on a property after the first legal charge.
It is a legal agreement where the property owner borrows money and uses the property as collateral for the loan.
The second legal charge ranks lower in priority compared to the first legal charge, which means that in case of default and enforcement, the proceeds from the sale of the property will be used to repay the debts of the first charge before the second charge.
The holder of the second legal charge has a secondary interest in the property and may face higher risks.
The terms and conditions of the second legal charge, such as interest rate, repayment plan, and rights of the charge holder, are specified in the mortgage agreement.
Registering the second legal charge at the land registry informs potential buyers and other interested parties about the encumbrances on the property.

第二順位法律負擔是在土地註冊處登記的一種抵押貸款形式。
這是一份法律協議，其中房地產擁有人借錢，並以該房地產作為貸款的擔保物。
第二順位法律負擔在優先順位上低於第一順位法律負擔，這意味著在違約和強制執行時，出售房地產所獲得的款項將先用於償還第一順位債務，然後才是第二順位債務。
第二順位法律負擔持有人對該房地產具有次要的利益，可能面臨較高的風險。
第二順位法律負擔的條款和條件，如利率、還款計劃和持有人的權益，都在抵押貸款協議中明確規定。
在土地註冊處登記第二順位法律負擔，通知潛在買家和其他利害關係人該房地產上的負擔。
This type of document refers to a registered legal charge on a property that ranks second in priority, meaning it has a lower priority for repayment compared to the first legal charge.
此類文件是指對財產註冊的法律抵押，排名次於第一順位法律抵押，償還優先順序較低。
SECOND LEGAL CHARGE/MORTGAGE:
A second legal charge/mortgage is a type of mortgage registered under the land registry.
It is a legal agreement where the owner of the property borrows money and uses the property as collateral for the loan.
The second legal charge/mortgage has a lower priority compared to the first legal charge/mortgage, which means that in case of default and enforcement, the proceeds from the sale of the property will be used to repay the first charge/mortgage debt before the second charge/mortgage debt.
The holder of the second legal charge/mortgage has a secondary interest in the property and may face higher risks.
The terms and conditions of the second legal charge/mortgage, such as interest rate, repayment plan, and rights of the holder, are specified in the mortgage agreement.
Registering the second legal charge/mortgage at the land registry notifies potential buyers and other stakeholders of the encumbrance on the property.

第二順位法律抵押權（Second Legal Charge/Mortgage）是一種在土地登記簿下註冊的抵押權。
這是一份法律協議，房產擁有人借錢並以該房產作為貸款的擔保。
第二順位法律抵押權相對於第一順位法律抵押權的優先順位較低，這意味著在違約和強制執行的情況下，賣出該房產的款項將先用於償還第一順位抵押權的債務，然後才是第二順位抵押權的債務。
第二順位法律抵押權的持有人在該房產中具有次級利益，可能面臨較高的風險。
第二順位法律抵押權的條款和條件，如利率、還款計劃和持有人的權利，都在抵押合同中明確規定。
在土地登記簿上註冊第二順位法律抵押權可通知潛在買家和其他利益相關者該房產的負擔狀況。
This type of document refers to a legal charge/mortgage registered against a property that holds a secondary priority after the first legal charge/mortgage in terms of repayment priority.
這種文件指的是在房地產上登記的法定負擔/抵押權，其在還款優先順序上次於第一順位的法定負擔/抵押權。
SECOND MORTGAGE:
A second mortgage is a type of mortgage registered under the land registry.
It is a legal agreement where the property owner borrows money using the property as collateral.
A second mortgage is subordinate to the first mortgage, meaning that in case of default and foreclosure, the proceeds from the sale of the property will first go towards repaying the debt of the first mortgage before addressing the debt of the second mortgage.
Second mortgages are often used when the property owner wants to access additional funds while keeping the first mortgage intact.
The terms and conditions of a second mortgage, including interest rates, repayment terms, and the rights of the mortgage holder, are outlined in the mortgage contract.
Registering a second mortgage under the land registry notifies potential buyers and other interested parties of the property's encumbrances.

二次抵押貸款是一種在土地登記處登記的抵押貸款。
它是一項法律協議，房產所有者以該房產作為抵押來借款。
二次抵押貸款位於第一抵押貸款之後，這意味著在發生違約和查封的情況下，出售房產所得款項將首先用於償還第一抵押貸款的債務，然後再處理二次抵押貸款的債務。
當房產所有者希望獲得額外資金但保留第一抵押貸款時，常會使用二次抵押貸款。
二次抵押貸款的條款和條件，包括利率、還款條款和抵押權人的權益，均在抵押合同中明確規定。
在土地登記處登記二次抵押貸款可以通知潛在買家和其他相關方該房產的負擔。
This type of document refers to a registered mortgage on a property that holds a secondary position in terms of repayment priority compared to the first mortgage.
這類文件指的是在不動產上註冊的抵押貸款，其償還優先順序次於第一抵押貸款。
SECOND SUPPLEMENTAL STATUTORY DECLARATIO:
A second supplemental statutory declaration is a legal document filed with the land registry.
It is used to provide additional information or make amendments to a previously filed statutory declaration.
This declaration is typically made after the initial statutory declaration has been registered.
The purpose of the second supplemental statutory declaration is to update or clarify information related to the property or the parties involved.
It may include changes to the property description, ownership details, or any other relevant information.
By filing a second supplemental statutory declaration, the registered information can be updated to reflect the most accurate and current details.
It serves as an official record that supplements the original statutory declaration, ensuring the accuracy and completeness of the land registry records.

第二份補充法定宣誓書是在土地註冊處登記的法律文件。
它用於提供額外的資訊或對先前登記的法定宣誓書進行修正。
通常在初次法定宣誓書登記後，補充法定宣誓書才會被提出。
第二份補充法定宣誓書的目的是更新或澄清與物業或相關方的資訊。
可能包括物業描述、所有權詳情或其他相關資訊的更改。
透過提出第二份補充法定宣誓書，註冊的資訊可以更新以反映最準確和最新的詳情。
它作為一個正式的記錄，補充原始的法定宣誓書，確保土地註冊處的記錄的準確和完整。
This type of document is a supplementary declaration filed after the initial statutory declaration to provide additional information or make amendments regarding the property.
這類文件是在最初的法定聲明之後提交的補充聲明，以提供關於該物業的附加信息或進行修正。
STATUTORY DECLARATION:
A statutory declaration is a legal document used in the land registry.
It is a written statement made under oath or affirmation by an individual.
The purpose of a statutory declaration is to provide factual information regarding a property or related matters.
It may include details about ownership, boundaries, encumbrances, or other relevant information.
The declaration is signed by the declarant and witnessed by a person authorized to administer oaths.
Statutory declarations are used to establish or confirm specific facts related to the property.
They serve as formal evidence and are relied upon by the land registry to maintain accurate records.
Statutory declarations play a crucial role in ensuring the integrity and transparency of land registration processes.

法定宣誓是土地登記中使用的法律文件。
它是由個人在宣誓或確認的情況下提出的書面聲明。
法定宣誓的目的是提供有關房產或相關事項的事實信息。
它可能包括有關所有權、界線、負擔或其他相關信息的詳細內容。
宣誓書由宣誓人簽署，並由授權行使宣誓權力的人作證。
法定宣誓用於確定或確認與房產有關的特定事實。
它們作為正式的證據，被土地登記機構所依賴，以保持準確的記錄。
法定宣誓在確保土地登記過程的完整性和透明度方面起著重要作用。
This type of document is a formal written statement made by a person, declaring certain facts or information related to the property.
這種文件是由一個人正式提交的書面聲明，聲明與該財產相關的某些事實或信息。
SUBCHARGE/SUBMORTGAGE:
A subcharge/submortgage is a type of legal instrument used in the land registry.
It refers to a secondary charge/mortgage that is created on a property already subject to an existing primary charge/mortgage.
The subcharge/submortgage is typically created when a property owner wants to borrow additional funds against their property.
It ranks below the primary charge/mortgage in terms of priority, meaning that the primary charge/mortgage holder has a higher claim on the property in case of default.
The subcharge/submortgage is registered with the land registry to establish its existence and priority.
It outlines the terms and conditions of the secondary charge/mortgage, including the amount borrowed, interest rate, repayment terms, and any other relevant provisions.
The subcharge/submortgage allows the property owner to access additional financing while the primary charge/mortgage remains in place.
It is an important legal document that protects the rights and interests of both the subcharge/submortgage holder and the primary charge/mortgage holder.

一個次要負擔（subcharge）/次要按揭（submortgage）是土地註冊中使用的一種法律工具。
它指的是在已經存在主要負擔（primary charge）/主要按揭（primary mortgage）的財產上創建的次要負擔（subcharge）/次要按揭（submortgage）。
次要負擔（subcharge）/次要按揭（submortgage）通常在財產業主希望對其財產再借入額外資金時創建。
它在優先順序上低於主要負擔（primary charge）/主要按揭（primary mortgage），這意味著在違約情況下，主要負擔（primary charge）/主要按揭（primary mortgage）持有人對財產享有更高的索賠權。
次要負擔（subcharge）/次要按揭（submortgage）在土地註冊中登記，以確立其存在和優先順序。
它列出了次要負擔（subcharge）/次要按揭（submortgage）的條款和條件，包括借款金額、利率、還款條款和其他相關條款。
次要負擔（subcharge）/次要按揭（submortgage）允許財產業主在主要負擔（primary charge）/主要按揭（primary mortgage）仍然存在的情況下獲得額外的融資。
它是一份重要的法律文件，保護次要負擔（subcharge）/次要按揭（submortgage）持有人和主要負擔（primary charge）/主要按揭（primary mortgage）持有人的權益。
This type of document refers to an additional charge or mortgage placed on a property that already has an existing charge or mortgage registered.
這種文件是指對已經註冊了現有負擔或抵押權的財產進行額外的負擔或抵押權設定。
SUBDEED OF MUTUAL COVENANT AND MANAGEMEN:
A subdeed of mutual covenant and management agreement with plan is a legal document used in land registry.
It refers to an agreement between multiple parties, usually owners of properties within a development or estate.
The purpose of this agreement is to establish rules, regulations, and guidelines for the management and maintenance of the shared areas or common facilities within the development.
It includes provisions regarding the use, maintenance, repair, and insurance of the shared areas or facilities.
The subdeed of mutual covenant and management agreement with plan outlines the rights and obligations of the parties involved, such as property owners and the management authority.
It may also contain provisions related to fees, assessments, dispute resolution, and governance of the shared areas or facilities.
This agreement is crucial for ensuring harmonious and efficient management of the shared spaces within a development or estate.

共同契約和管理協議附計劃書是土地登記中使用的法律文件。
它指的是多方之間的協議，通常是在開發區域或地產中的業主之間達成的。
該協議的目的是建立對共享區域或共用設施的管理和維護的規則、條例和指南。
它包括有關共享區域或設施的使用、維護、修理和保險的條款。
共同契約和管理協議附計劃書明確規定了參與方（如業主和管理機構）的權利和義務。
它還可能包含有關費用、評估、爭議解決和共享區域或設施的治理的條款。
這份協議對於確保開發區域或地產中的共享空間的和諧和高效管理至關重要。
This type of document refers to an agreement that outlines the mutual obligations and management arrangements among multiple parties regarding a property, including a plan.
此類文件是指一份協議，詳細說明了多方之間就一個物業的相互義務和管理安排，包括一份計劃。
SUBDEED OF MUTUAL COVENANT WITH PLAN:
A subdeed of mutual covenant with plan is a legal document used in land registry.
It refers to an agreement between multiple parties, typically among owners within a development area or property.
The purpose of this agreement is to establish rules, regulations, and guidelines for the management and maintenance of shared areas or facilities.
It includes provisions regarding the use, maintenance, repair, and insurance of the shared areas or facilities.
The subdeed of mutual covenant with plan clearly outlines the rights and obligations of the parties involved, such as the owners and the management entity.
It may also include provisions concerning costs, assessments, dispute resolution, and governance of the shared areas or facilities.
This agreement is crucial for ensuring harmonious and efficient management of shared spaces within a development area or property.

互惠契約副契約與計劃書（Subdeed of Mutual Covenant with Plan）是土地註冊中使用的法律文件。
它指的是一份協議，通常是在開發區域或物業內的業主之間締結。
此協議的目的是建立對共用區域或設施的管理和維護的規則、條款和指南。
它包括關於共用區域或設施的使用、維護、修理和保險的規定。
互惠契約副契約與計劃書清楚地概述了參與方（例如業主和管理實體）的權利和義務。
它還可能包括有關費用、評估、爭議解決和共用區域或設施的管理的規定。
這份協議對於確保開發區域或物業內的共用空間的和諧和高效管理至關重要。
This type of document refers to an agreement that outlines the mutual obligations and covenants among multiple parties regarding a property, including the inclusion of a plan.
這類文件是指一份協議，其中詳細說明了多個相關方對於一項物業的相互義務和契約，其中包括一份平面圖。
SUBMORTGAGE:
A submortgage refers to a secondary mortgage that is created on a property that already has an existing primary mortgage.
It involves the transfer of a portion of the mortgage rights and obligations from the original mortgagee (lender) to a new lender.
The submortgage is registered under the land registry to establish the new lender's legal interest in the property.
The submortgage holder has a lower priority compared to the primary mortgage holder, meaning that in the event of default and foreclosure, the primary mortgage holder is paid first.
The submortgage allows the property owner to secure additional financing by using the property as collateral without paying off the primary mortgage.
The terms and conditions of the submortgage, such as interest rates, repayment terms, and rights of the submortgage holder, are defined in a separate agreement.
The submortgage holder has the right to enforce the submortgage in case of default by the property owner.

子抵押是指在已存在主要抵押的房地產上建立的次級抵押。
它涉及將原抵押權利和義務的一部分從原始抵押擔保人（貸方）轉移給新的貸方。
子抵押在土地登記簿下註冊，以確立新貸方對該房地產的法律利益。
子抵押持有人的優先順序較低，與主要抵押持有人相比，在拖欠和強制執行的情況下，主要抵押持有人優先受償。
子抵押允許房產所有人在不償還主要抵押的情況下，以該房地產作為擔保物獲得額外融資。
子抵押的條款和條件，如利率、還款條款和子抵押持有人的權利，在另一份協議中明確規定。
子抵押持有人有權在房產所有人拖欠款項時執行子抵押權。
This type of document refers to a mortgage that is subordinate to the primary mortgage on a property, allowing for additional borrowing secured by the property.
這種文件是指在一個財產上設定的次級抵押貸款，允許透過該財產進行額外借款。
SUPERSEDING NOTICE UNDER S.30B(3) OF THE:
A superseding notice under s.30B(3) of the Buildings Ordinance is a legal document filed with the land registry.
It is used to notify the land registry of a new building plan or modified plan that supersedes the previously submitted plan.
The purpose of the superseding notice is to update the land registry with the latest information regarding the construction or modification of a building.
The notice includes details such as the building project reference number, the date of the superseding notice, and the description of the changes or modifications made.
The superseding notice ensures that the land registry has accurate and up-to-date information about the building project.
It helps maintain transparency and legal compliance in the construction and modification of buildings.
The notice may also include any additional documentation or supporting materials related to the changes or modifications made.

根據建築法第30B(3)條的修正通知書是一份在土地註冊處登記的法律文件。
它用於通知土地註冊處有一份新的建築計劃或修改計劃取代先前提交的計劃。
修正通知書的目的是向土地註冊處更新有關建築物建設或修改的最新信息。
通知書包括建築項目參考號碼、修正通知書日期以及所進行的更改或修改的描述。
修正通知書確保土地註冊處獲得有關建築項目的準確和最新信息。
它有助於在建築物的建設和修改過程中維護透明度和法律合規性。
通知書還可能包括與所進行的更改或修改相關的任何額外文件或支持材料。
This type of document refers to a notice filed under Section 30B(3) of the Buildings Ordinance that supersedes a previous notice related to a property.
進行不動產登記查詢時，發現有「根據《建築物條例》第30B(3)條的覆蓋通知」的註冊。請解釋這是什麼意思，用「這類文件」來替換「根據《建築物條例》第30B(3)條的覆蓋通知」來回答。
SUPERSEDING NOTICE UNDER S.30C(3) OF THE:
A superseding notice under section 30C(3) of the Buildings Ordinance is a legal document registered with the Land Registry.
It is used to notify the Land Registry that a new building plan or amended plan supersedes the previously submitted plan.
The purpose of the superseding notice is to provide updated information to the Land Registry regarding the construction or modification of a building.
The notice includes the reference number of the building project, the date of the superseding notice, and a description of the changes or amendments made.
The superseding notice ensures that the Land Registry has accurate and up-to-date information about the building project.
It helps maintain transparency and legal compliance throughout the construction and modification process of the building.
The notice may also include any additional documents or supporting materials related to the changes or amendments made.

建築條例第30C(3)條下的更新通知是一份在土地註冊處登記的法律文件。
它用於通知土地註冊處，一個新的建築計劃或修改後的計劃取代了先前提交的計劃。
更新通知的目的是向土地註冊處提供有關建築物的施工或修改的最新信息。
通知包括建築項目的參考編號、更新通知的日期，以及對變更或修改的描述。
更新通知確保土地註冊處擁有有關建築項目的準確和最新信息。
它有助於在建築物的施工和修改過程中維護透明度和法律合規性。
通知還可能包括與變更或修改相關的任何其他文件或支持材料。
This type of document refers to a registered notice issued under Section 30C(3) of the Buildings Ordinance, which supersedes a previous notice related to the building in question.
這類文件是指根據《建築物條例》第30C(3)條發出的已登記通知，該通知取代了與該建築物有關的先前通知。
SUPERSEDING ORDER UNDER S.24(1) OF THE B:
A superseding order under Section 24(1) of the Buildings Ordinance is a legal document registered with the Land Registry.
It is used to revoke or replace a previous order issued under Section 24(1) of the Buildings Ordinance.
The purpose of a superseding order is to modify or update the requirements, conditions, or restrictions imposed on a building project.
The order may be issued by the Buildings Department or another relevant authority responsible for enforcing building regulations.
It specifies the reference number of the original order, the date of the superseding order, and the revised requirements or conditions.
The superseding order ensures that the Land Registry has the most up-to-date information regarding the building project and its legal obligations.
It helps maintain compliance with building regulations and ensures transparency in the development process.

根據《建築物條例》第24(1)條，超越性令狀（Superseding Order）是一份在土地註冊處登記的法律文件。
它用於撤銷或取代根據《建築物條例》第24(1)條發出的先前令狀。
超越性令狀的目的是修改或更新對建築項目所施加的要求、條件或限制。
令狀可以由建築署或其他負責執行建築法規的相關機構發出。
它明確指定原始令狀的參考編號、超越性令狀的日期以及修訂後的要求或條件。
超越性令狀確保土地註冊處擁有關於建築項目及其法律義務的最新資訊。
它有助於確保建築法規的遵從，並確保開發過程的透明度。
This type of document refers to a registered order issued under Section 24(1) of the Buildings Ordinance, which supersedes a previous order related to the building.
此類文件指的是根據《建築物條例》第24(1)條發出的已登記命令，該命令取代了與建築物相關的先前命令。

A superseding order under Section 24(1) of the Buildings Ordinance with Plan is a legal document registered at the Land Registry.
It is used to revoke or replace a previous order issued under Section 24(1) of the Buildings Ordinance with Plan.
The purpose of the superseding order is to modify or update the requirements, conditions, or restrictions imposed on a building project.
The order can be issued by the Buildings Department or other relevant authorities responsible for enforcing building regulations.
It specifies the reference number of the original order, the date of the superseding order, and the revised requirements or conditions.
The superseding order ensures that the Land Registry has the latest information regarding the building project and its legal obligations.
It helps ensure compliance with building regulations and transparency in the development process.

根據《建築物條例》第24(1)條附圖，具有計劃的「更正命令」是在土地註冊處登記的法律文件。
它用於撤銷或替換先前根據《建築物條例》第24(1)條附圖發出的命令。
這項更正命令的目的是修改或更新對建築項目所加以的要求、條件或限制。
建築署或其他負責執行建築法規的相關機構可以發出這項命令。
它會指定原始命令的參考編號、更正命令的日期以及修訂後的要求或條件。
更正命令確保土地註冊處擁有有關建築項目及其法律義務的最新資訊。
它有助於確保遵守建築法規，並增加發展過程的透明度。
This type of document refers to a registered order issued under Section 24(1) of the Buildings Ordinance, which supersedes a previous order and includes a plan related to the building.
這種文件是指根據《建築物條例》第24(1)條所發出的已登記命令，該命令取代先前的命令，並包含與建築物有關的平面圖。
SUPERSEDING ORDER UNDER S.26 OF THE BUIL:
A "Superseding Order under s.26 of the Buildings Ordinance" is a legal document registered with the Land Registry.
It is issued under Section 26 of the Buildings Ordinance, which relates to unauthorized building works.
The Superseding Order is used to revoke or replace a previous order issued under Section 26.
It is typically issued by the Buildings Department or other relevant authorities responsible for enforcing building regulations.
The purpose of the Superseding Order is to modify or update the requirements, conditions, or restrictions imposed on unauthorized building works.
The order will specify the reference number of the original order, the date of the Superseding Order, and the revised requirements or conditions.
By registering the Superseding Order, the Land Registry ensures that it has the latest information regarding the unauthorized building works and their legal obligations.
The Superseding Order helps to ensure compliance with building regulations and increases transparency in the development process.

"根據《建築物條例》第26條所簽發的更新令"是一份在土地註冊處登記的法律文件。
它是根據《建築物條例》第26條發出的，與未經許可的建築工程有關。
更新令用於撤銷或替換先前根據第26條發出的命令。
通常由建築署或其他負責執行建築法規的相關機構發出。
更新令的目的是修改或更新對未經許可的建築工程所施加的要求、條件或限制。
該命令將指定原始命令的參考編號、更新令的日期和修改後的要求或條件。
透過登記更新令，土地註冊處確保擁有有關未經許可的建築工程及其法律義務的最新信息。
更新令有助於確保建築法規的遵守，增加發展過程的透明度。
This type of document refers to a registered order issued under Section 26 of the Buildings Ordinance that supersedes or replaces a previous order concerning the property.
這類文件指的是根據《建築物條例》第26條發出的註冊命令，該命令取代或取代之前有關該物業的命令。
SUPPLEMENTAL AGREEMENT:
A supplemental agreement is a legal document registered under the land registry.
It is an additional agreement that modifies or adds to an existing agreement related to a property.
The purpose of a supplemental agreement is to update, clarify, or expand upon the terms and conditions of the original agreement.
It may address specific aspects such as amendments to the purchase price, changes in payment terms, or additional provisions.
The supplemental agreement is typically entered into by the parties involved in the original agreement, such as the buyer and seller or the landlord and tenant.
It is designed to ensure that any changes or additions to the original agreement are properly documented and legally binding.
The registration of the supplemental agreement at the land registry provides public notice and evidentiary value of the revised terms.
By registering the supplemental agreement, it becomes an official record of the property's legal history and can be referred to for future transactions or disputes.

附加協議是根據土地註冊處登記的法律文件。
它是對與房地產有關的現有協議進行修改或補充的額外協議。
附加協議的目的是更新、澄清或擴展原始協議的條款和條件。
它可能涉及特定方面，如修改購買價格、更改付款條件或添加其他條款。
附加協議通常由原始協議的相關方（如買方和賣方或房東和租戶）簽署。
它旨在確保對原始協議的任何更改或補充都得到正確記錄並具有法律約束力。
在土地註冊處登記附加協議，可以提供公開通知和證據價值，關於修改後的條款。
通過登記附加協議，它成為該房地產法律歷史的正式記錄，可以用於未來的交易或爭議。
This type of document refers to an additional agreement that is made to modify or supplement the terms of an existing agreement related to the property.
「此類文件」指的是為修改或補充現有與該物業相關的協議條款而簽訂的額外協議。
SUPPLEMENTAL STATUTORY DECLARATION:
A supplemental statutory declaration is a legal document registered with the land registry.
It is an additional declaration made by a party involved in a property transaction.
The purpose of the supplemental statutory declaration is to provide additional information or clarify certain aspects of the original statutory declaration.
It may address changes in circumstances, corrections, or updates to the original declaration.
The supplemental statutory declaration is typically signed by the relevant parties involved in the transaction.
It serves as an official record of any additional statements or disclosures related to the property.
Registering the supplemental statutory declaration provides public notice and evidentiary value regarding the additional information or changes.
By being registered with the land registry, the supplemental statutory declaration becomes a formal part of the property's legal history and can be referenced in future transactions or disputes.

附加法定宣言是在土地註冊處登記的法律文件。
這是由參與房地產交易的一方提出的額外宣言。
附加法定宣言的目的是提供額外的信息或澄清原始法定宣言中的某些方面。
它可能涉及到情況的變化、更正或對原始宣言的更新。
附加法定宣言通常由相關交易方簽署。
它作為一份正式文件記錄了與該物業相關的任何額外聲明或披露。
通過在土地註冊處登記附加法定宣言，可以公開通知並具有證明價值，關於額外信息或變更。
通過在土地註冊處登記，附加法定宣言成為該物業法律歷史的正式部分，並可在未來交易或爭議中引用。
This type of document refers to a supplementary declaration made under statutory provisions to provide additional information or clarification related to the property.
這類文件是指根據法定條款所作的補充性聲明，旨在提供有關該物業的額外信息或澄清。
TENANCY AGREEMENT:
A tenancy agreement is a legal contract between a landlord and a tenant.
It outlines the terms and conditions of the rental arrangement for a property.
The agreement specifies details such as the rental period, rent amount, payment terms, and responsibilities of both parties.
It may also include provisions related to maintenance, repairs, and termination of the tenancy.
The tenancy agreement serves as evidence of the rights and obligations of both the landlord and the tenant.
It provides clarity and protection for both parties by establishing a legally binding agreement.
The agreement may be signed by both parties and witnessed, ensuring its validity and enforceability.
A tenancy agreement is an important document in the management and administration of rental properties, ensuring a fair and transparent relationship between landlords and tenants.

租賃合約是房東與租戶之間的合法合約。
它概述了房屋租賃安排的條款和條件。
合約明確規定租賃期限、租金金額、付款條款以及雙方的責任。
它還可能包括與維護、修理和租賃終止相關的條款。
租賃合約作為房東和租戶權益和義務的證據。
它確立了一個具有法律約束力的協議，為雙方提供了明確性和保護。
租賃合約可能由雙方簽署並經證人見證，以確保其有效性和可執行性。
租賃合約在租賃房屋的管理和行政中扮演著重要角色，確保房東和租戶之間的公平透明關係。
This type of document refers to a legally binding agreement between a landlord and a tenant, outlining the terms and conditions of the rental arrangement for the property.
這類文件是指房東與租戶之間的法律約定，規定了租賃物業的租賃條款和條件。
THIRD LEGAL CHARGE:
A third legal charge is a form of security interest placed on a property.
It is created when a property owner borrows money and uses the property as collateral.
The third legal charge ranks below the first and second charges in priority.
It gives the lender the right to recover their debt from the proceeds of the property's sale.
The existence of a third legal charge may affect the ability of the property owner to obtain further borrowing secured against the property.
It is typically registered with the land registry to provide notice to other potential lenders or buyers.
The terms and conditions of the third legal charge are outlined in a legal document.
In the event of default, the lender with the third legal charge can initiate legal action to enforce their rights and recover the debt.

第三順位法律負擔是對房產所做的一種安全利益。
當房產所有人借錢並以房產作為擔保品時，就會產生第三順位法律負擔。
第三順位法律負擔在優先順序上低於第一和第二順位負擔。
它賦予貸款人從房產出售的收益中追回債務的權利。
第三順位法律負擔的存在可能影響房產所有人進一步以房產為擔保獲得借款的能力。
通常在土地註冊處登記第三順位法律負擔，以通知其他潛在貸款人或買家。
第三順位法律負擔的條款和條件在一份法律文件中明確規定。
在違約情況下，擁有第三順位法律負擔的貸款人可以採取法律行動來執行他們的權利並追回債務。
This type of document refers to a legal charge or mortgage that is registered against a property, ranking third in priority among other charges or mortgages.
這種文件是指針對一個財產註冊的法律負擔或抵押，其在其他負擔或抵押中排名第三位的文件。
THIRD MORTGAGE:
A third mortgage is a type of loan secured against a property.
It is created when the owner of the property borrows money and uses the property as collateral, after the first and second mortgages have already been established.
A third mortgage is subordinate to the first and second mortgages in terms of priority.
It gives the lender the right to recover the debt from the proceeds of the property's sale, but only after the first and second mortgage holders have been paid.
The existence of a third mortgage may affect the property owner's ability to secure further loans using the property as collateral.
Typically, the details of the third mortgage are registered at the land registry to notify other potential lenders or buyers.
The terms and conditions of the third mortgage are outlined in a legal document.
In the event of default, the lender holding the third mortgage can take legal action to enforce their rights and recover the debt.

第三抵押是一種以房地產作為擔保的貸款形式。
當房地產擁有者在已存在第一和第二抵押的基礎上借錢並以該房地產作為擔保時，就會產生第三抵押。
第三抵押在優先順序上位於第一和第二抵押之後。
它賦予借款人在售出該房地產後優先還款的權利，但只有在支付了第一和第二抵押債權之後。
第三抵押的存在可能會影響房地產擁有者通過以該房地產作為擔保來獲得進一步貸款的能力。
通常，第三抵押的詳細信息將在土地登記處登記，以通知其他潛在的貸款人或買家。
第三抵押的條款和條件會在一份法律文件中詳細列出。
如果出現違約情況，持有第三抵押的借款人可以採取法律行動來執行其權利並追回債務。
This type of document refers to a mortgage that is registered on a property as a third-ranking mortgage, meaning it has lower priority compared to previous mortgages or charges.
這類文件指的是在財產上登記的第三順位抵押貸款，這表示相較於之前的抵押貸款或收費，此抵押貸款的優先順序較低。
THREE-PARTY MORTGAGE DEED:
A three-party mortgage deed is a legal document that involves three parties: the borrower, the lender, and a third party, such as a guarantor or a co-mortgagor.
It is used when a third party is involved in providing security or guarantee for the mortgage.
The three-party mortgage deed outlines the terms and conditions of the mortgage agreement, including the loan amount, interest rate, repayment terms, and the rights and responsibilities of each party.
The third party may be responsible for repaying the loan if the borrower defaults on the mortgage.
The three-party mortgage deed is typically registered with the land registry to ensure legal recognition and protection.
It provides clarity and transparency regarding the rights and obligations of all parties involved.
The three-party mortgage deed may require the consent or agreement of all parties for any changes or modifications to the mortgage terms.
In the event of foreclosure or sale of the property, the proceeds are distributed according to the terms specified in the deed.

三方按揭契約是一份涉及三方的法律文件，包括借款人、貸款人和第三方（例如擔保人或共同按揭人）。
當第三方參與提供按揭的安全性或擔保時，會使用三方按揭契約。
三方按揭契約概述了按揭協議的條款和條件，包括貸款金額、利率、還款條件，以及每個當事人的權利和責任。
如果借款人違約，第三方可能負責償還貸款。
三方按揭契約通常在土地註冊處登記，以確保法律認可和保護。
它為所有參與方的權利和義務提供明確和透明的規定。
三方按揭契約可能需要所有當事人的同意或協議才能進行任何變更或修改。
在財產被查封或出售的情況下，按揭契約中指定的條款決定收益的分配方式。
This type of document refers to a mortgage deed involving three parties: the borrower, the lender, and a third party who may have an interest in the property.
這類文件指的是涉及三方的抵押契約，包括借款人、貸款人和可能對該房產有利益的第三方。
TRANSFER OF MORTGAGE:
Transfer of Mortgage refers to the process of transferring an existing mortgage from one lender to another.
It involves the legal transfer of the rights and obligations of the original mortgage from the current lender (transferor) to a new lender (transferee).
The transfer is typically done through a formal agreement or document, which outlines the terms and conditions of the transfer.
The transferee becomes the new mortgage holder and assumes the responsibilities of collecting payments and enforcing the terms of the mortgage.
The transfer may occur due to various reasons, such as refinancing, loan restructuring, or the sale of mortgage portfolios.
The Land Registry records the transfer of mortgage to ensure legal recognition and protection.
The transfer process may require the consent of all parties involved, including the borrower and the existing lender.
Upon completion of the transfer, the new lender assumes all the rights, interests, and obligations associated with the mortgage.

貸款轉讓是指將現有的貸款從一家貸款機構轉移給另一家的過程。
它涉及將原始貸款的權益和義務從現有的貸款機構（轉讓方）轉移給新的貸款機構（受讓方）。
轉讓通常通過正式的協議或文件進行，其中規定了轉讓的條款和條件。
受讓方成為新的貸款持有人，承擔收取付款和執行貸款條款的責任。
貸款轉讓可能由於各種原因而進行，例如再融資、貸款重組或貸款組合的出售。
土地註冊處記錄貸款轉讓，以確保法律承認和保護。
貸款轉讓的過程可能需要所有相關方的同意，包括借款人和現有貸款機構。
在轉讓完成後，新的貸款機構承擔與貸款相關的所有權益、利益和義務。
This type of document refers to the transfer of an existing mortgage from one lender to another, typically occurring when the property ownership changes hands or when refinancing takes place.
這類文件是指將現有的抵押貸款從一家貸款人轉移到另一家貸款人的過程，通常在產權轉移或再融資時發生。
TRIPARTITE EQUITABLE MORTGAGE:
A tripartite equitable mortgage is a type of mortgage involving three parties: the borrower, the lender, and a third-party beneficiary.
It is a legal agreement that establishes a security interest in a property to secure a loan or debt.
The borrower, who owns the property, pledges it as collateral to the lender to secure the loan.
The lender provides the loan funds to the borrower based on the value of the property.
The third-party beneficiary, often a trustee or a party with an interest in the property, holds the mortgage on behalf of the lender.
The tripartite nature of the mortgage ensures that the lender's interest in the property is protected and that the third-party beneficiary acts as a neutral party in the transaction.
In case of default, the lender can enforce the mortgage and potentially sell the property to recover the loan amount.
The tripartite equitable mortgage is typically recorded in the land registry to establish the lender's legal claim on the property.

三方平等抵押是一種涉及三方的抵押，包括借款人、貸款人和第三方受益人。
這是一份法律協議，旨在為貸款或債務提供房產作為擔保。
借款人作為擁有該房產的人，將其抵押給貸款人，以確保貸款。
貸款人根據房產的價值向借款人提供貸款資金。
第三方受益人通常是一個受託人或對該房產有利益的一方，代表貸款人持有抵押權益。
三方平等抵押確保了貸款人對該房產的權益得到保護，同時第三方受益人充當交易中的中立方。
在借款人違約的情況下，貸款人可以執行抵押權，並有可能出售該房產以收回貸款金額。
通常將三方平等抵押登記在土地註冊處，以確立貸款人對該房產的法律權益。
This type of document refers to a mortgage agreement involving three parties: the borrower, the lender, and a third party who holds the property as security for the loan.
這種文件是指涉及三方的抵押協議，包括借款人、貸款人和第三方持有的物業作為貸款的擔保品。
TRIPARTITE LEGAL CHARGE/MORTGAGE:
Involves three parties: borrower, lender, and a third-party beneficiary.
Legal agreement that uses the property as collateral for a loan or debt.
Borrower, who owns the property, mortgages it to the lender as security for the loan.
Lender provides loan funds to the borrower based on the value of the property.
Third-party beneficiary is typically a trustee or party with an interest in the property, representing the lender's mortgage interest.
Tripartite equitable mortgage ensures the lender's interest in the property is protected while the third-party beneficiary acts as a neutral party in the transaction.
In case of borrower default, the lender can enforce the mortgage and potentially sell the property to recover the loan amount.
Tripartite equitable mortgages are often registered at the land registry to establish the lender's legal interest in the property.

涉及三方：借款人、貸款人和第三方受益人。
是一份法律協議，以財產作為貸款或債務的擔保物。
借款人作為抵押品將其所擁有的財產抵押給貸款人作為貸款的擔保物。
貸款人根據財產的價值提供貸款給借款人。
第三方受益人通常是受託人或對財產有利益的一方，代表貸款人的抵押權益。
三方抵押確保了貸款人在財產中的利益得到保護，而第三方受益人在交易中扮演著中立方的角色。
在借款人違約的情況下，貸款人可以執行抵押權，並有可能出售該財產以收回貸款金額。
三方抵押通常在土地註冊處登記，以確立貸款人對該財產的法律利益。
This type of document refers to a mortgage or charge involving three parties: the borrower, the lender, and a third party holding the property as collateral.
這類文件指的是涉及三方的抵押或負擔，包括借款人、貸款人和作為擔保物的第三方的抵押或負擔文件。
TRIPARTITE MORTGAGE/LEGAL CHARGE:
Involves three parties: the borrower, the lender, and a third-party beneficiary.
It is a legal agreement where property is used as security for a loan or debt.
The borrower pledges their owned property to the lender as collateral for the loan.
The lender provides a loan to the borrower based on the value of the property.
The third-party beneficiary is typically a trustee or a party with an interest in the property, representing the lender's mortgage interests.
The tripartite charge/mortgage ensures that the lender's interests in the property are protected, with the third-party beneficiary acting as a neutral party in the transaction.
In the event of default by the borrower, the lender can enforce the mortgage and may potentially sell the property to recover the loan amount.
Tripartite charges/mortgages are typically registered with the land registry to establish the lender's legal interests in the property.

涉及三方：借款人、貸方和第三方受益人。
這是一份法律協議，財產作為貸款或債務的擔保。
借款人將自己擁有的財產作為抵押品，向貸方提供擔保。
貸方根據財產的價值向借款人提供貸款。
第三方受益人通常是受託人或對財產有利益的一方，代表貸方的抵押權益。
三方負責/抵押確保貸方在財產上的利益受到保護，第三方受益人在交易中扮演中立方的角色。
在借款人違約的情況下，貸方可以執行抵押權，並可能出售財產以收回貸款金額。
通常將三方負責/抵押登記在土地註冊處，以確立貸方對財產的合法利益。
This type of document refers to a mortgage or legal charge that involves three parties, including the borrower, the lender, and a third party providing security for the loan.
這種文件是指涉及三方的抵押或法律負擔，包括借款人、貸款人和提供貸款擔保的第三方的文件。
TRIPARTITE SECOND LEGAL CHARGE/MORTGAGE:
Involves three parties: the borrower, the lender, and a third-party beneficiary.
It is a legal agreement where property is used as security for a loan or debt.
The borrower pledges their own property as collateral to the lender.
The lender provides a loan to the borrower based on the value of the property.
The third-party beneficiary is typically a trustee or a party with an interest in the property, representing the lender's mortgage interest.
The tripartite mortgage/charge ensures that the lender's interest in the property is protected, with the third-party beneficiary acting as a neutral party in the transaction.
In the event of default by the borrower, the lender can enforce the mortgage and may sell the property to recover the loan amount.
Tripartite mortgages/charges are typically registered in the land registry to establish the lender's legal interest in the property.

涉及三方：借款人、貸方和第三方受益人。
這是一份法律協議，其中財產被用作貸款或債務的擔保。
借款人將自己的財產作為擔保向貸方提供抵押品。
貸方根據財產的價值向借款人提供貸款。
第三方受益人通常是受託人或對財產有利益的一方，代表貸方的抵押權益。
三方抵押/押記確保了貸方對財產的利益受到保護，第三方受益人在交易中充當中立方。
在借款人違約的情況下，貸方可以執行抵押權，並可能出售財產以收回貸款金額。
三方抵押/押記通常在土地登記處登記，以確立貸方對財產的法律利益。
This type of document refers to a second legal charge/mortgage involving three parties, including the borrower, lender, and a third party providing additional security for the loan.
這種文件指的是涉及三方的第二順位法律負擔/抵押，包括借款人、貸方和提供額外擔保的第三方。
TWO-PARTY MORTGAGE DEED:
Involves three parties: the borrower, the lender, and a third-party beneficiary.
It is a legal agreement where the property is used as security for a loan or debt.
The borrower provides the property as collateral to the lender.
The lender grants a loan to the borrower based on the value of the property.
The third-party beneficiary is typically a trustee or party with an interest in the property, representing the lender's charge.
The tripartite second legal charge/mortgage ensures the protection of the lender's interest in the property, with the third-party beneficiary acting as a neutral party in the transaction.
In the event of default by the borrower, the lender can enforce the charge and may sell the property to recover the loan amount.
Tripartite second legal charge/mortgage is often registered at the land registry to establish the lender's legal interest in the property.

涉及三方：借款人、貸方和第三方受益人。
這是一份法律協議，其中財產被用作貸款或債務的擔保。
借款人將財產作為抵押品提供給貸方。
貸方根據財產的價值向借款人提供貸款。
第三方受益人通常是受託人或對財產有利益的一方，代表貸方的授權。
三方次級法律負擔/按揭確保了貸方對財產的利益保護，第三方受益人在交易中充當中立方。
如果借款人違約，貸方可以執行負擔，並可能出售財產以收回貸款金額。
通常將三方次級法律負擔/按揭登記在土地註冊處，確立貸方對財產的法律利益。
This type of document refers to a mortgage deed involving only two parties, the borrower and the lender, for securing a loan against the property.
此類文件是指涉及僅有兩方，即借款人和貸款人的抵押契約，用於將貸款與該物業作為擔保。
UNDERTAKING:
Involves two parties: the borrower (mortgagor) and the lender (mortgagee).
It is a legal document that outlines the terms and conditions of a mortgage agreement between the borrower and the lender.
The borrower pledges their property as collateral for the loan received from the lender.
The lender provides the loan amount to the borrower, secured by the property.
The mortgage deed contains details of the loan amount, interest rate, repayment terms, and any other relevant provisions.
It establishes the rights and obligations of both parties regarding the mortgage.
The borrower retains ownership of the property but grants the lender a legal interest (lien) on the property.
Failure to repay the loan as per the agreed terms may result in the lender exercising their rights, such as foreclosure or sale of the property.

涉及兩方當事人：借款人（抵押人）和貸款人（抵押權人）。
這是一份法律文件，概述了借款人和貸款人之間的抵押協議的條款和條件。
借款人將其房產作為貸款的抵押品。
貸款人提供貸款金額，以房產作為擔保。
抵押契約包含貸款金額、利率、還款條款和其他相關條款的細節。
它確立了借款人和貸款人在抵押貸款方面的權利和義務。
借款人保留對房產的所有權，但授予貸款人對房產的法律利益（留置權）。
如果未按照協議條款還款，貸款人可能行使其權利，如強制執行或出售房產。
This type of document is a legally binding promise or commitment made by one party to another, typically relating to a specific action or obligation.
這類文件是由一方對另一方作出的具有法律約束力的承諾或承諾，通常涉及特定的行動或義務。
UNDERTAKING LETTER:
It is a legally binding promise or commitment made by a party in relation to a property transaction.
The party giving the undertaking agrees to perform a specific action or refrain from doing something in the future.
It is often used to assure compliance with certain requirements or conditions.
The undertaking is typically given voluntarily and is enforceable by law.
It may be required by the land registry or other parties involved in the transaction to ensure the fulfillment of obligations.
Examples of undertakings include the payment of outstanding fees, completion of necessary repairs, or obtaining necessary approvals or consents.
Failure to fulfill an undertaking may result in legal consequences, such as financial penalties or legal action.
Undertakings provide a mechanism for parties to give assurances and maintain accountability in property transactions.

這是在土地註冊中由一方作出的具有法律約束力的承諾或承諾。
提供承諾的一方同意在將來執行特定行動或避免做某事。
通常用於確保遵守某些要求或條件。
承諾通常是自願提供的，並且受法律約束。
土地註冊或參與交易的其他方可能要求提供承諾，以確保履行義務。
承諾的例子包括支付未付款項，完成必要的修復工作或獲取必要的批准或同意。
如果未能履行承諾，可能會產生法律後果，例如財務罰款或法律訴訟。
承諾提供了一種機制，讓各方在財產交易中提供保證並保持責任。
This type of document is a written commitment or assurance given by one party to another, usually regarding specific actions or obligations.
這類文件是一份書面承諾或保證，由一方向另一方提供，通常涉及特定的行動或義務。
WAIVER LETTER:
An undertaking letter is a written document issued by a party involved in a land registry transaction.
It serves as a formal commitment or assurance to carry out certain actions or fulfill specific obligations.
The letter outlines the party's intention to perform certain tasks or meet certain requirements.
It is commonly used to provide assurance and guarantee compliance with legal or contractual obligations.
The undertaking letter may include promises to complete necessary repairs, obtain approvals or consents, or settle outstanding payments.
The letter is legally binding and signifies the party's commitment to fulfill their responsibilities.
Failure to comply with the undertaking may result in legal consequences, such as financial penalties or legal actions.
Undertaking letters play a crucial role in ensuring trust, accountability, and compliance in land registry transactions.

承諾信是由土地註冊交易中涉及的一方所發出的書面文件。
它作為一份正式的承諾或保證，承諾執行特定的行動或履行具體的義務。
該信件概述了該方履行特定任務或滿足特定要求的意向。
它通常用於提供確保和保證遵守法律或合同義務。
承諾信可能包括承諾完成必要的維修工作、獲得批准或同意，或清算未付款項。
該信件具有法律約束力，表示該方履行其責任的承諾。
不履行承諾可能導致法律後果，如金錢罰款或法律訴訟。
承諾信在土地註冊交易中起著確保信任、負責任和遵守的關鍵作用。
This type of document is a letter that formally waives or relinquishes certain rights, claims, or obligations between parties involved in a property transaction or agreement.
這種文件是一封正式放棄或放棄特定權利、索賠或義務的信函，在房地產交易或協議中的相關方之間使用。
